general.headline:
Partner, McCullough Robertson -
Specialist intellectual property lawyer
general.description:
I specialise in intellectual property law and head up the IP and trade marks practice at McCullough Robertson.  I advise clients in a wide range of industries on the development of new brands, intellectual property protection and management, opposition and infringement disputes, general trade mark matters and passing off in Australia and internationally (availability searches, filing, enforcement, opposition, non-use and trade mark watches).
 
Operating a full-service trade marks practice, with over 4,000 trade marks under management, I have a wealth of knowledge based on my  dealings with IP Australia and facilitating the filing and management of trade marks on a world-wide basis. 
 
I also act in relation to domain name advice, protection and disputes, business name registration and advice, intellectual property audits and due diligence, as well as the transfer, licensing, commercialisation and acquisition of intellectual property including trade marks, patents and copyright.  
 
I assist a broad range of clients from start-up businesses to major publicly listed companies, including a number of well-known brands. Clients include travel and accommodation businesses, mining and engineering companies, hotels, airports, agricultural companies, beverages, large retail brands, charities and many international referring firms. 
 
My dual qualifications in law and international business provide a valuable understanding of the challenges facing business today, particularly in an electronic age and I am known for my ability to tailor innovative, yet practical solutions.

Her position serves as a senior consultant to the Chairman and Board on the development and delivery of key strategic firm initiatives aligned to the firm's strategic plan and leads the management and business function deliverables.

Terri has held senior national management roles across the legal, consulting, finance, energy and mining sectors including DLA Piper, Holding Redlich, Gadens, QSuper Limited, Stanwell Corporation Limited, and Sinclair Knight Merz (now Jacobs).  She has led and engaged others through change in complex and high performance environments, with particular experience in professional legal talent consulting and strategies, workforce capability, organisational development, policy frameworks, project management and strategic planning.

Academically, she has completed a Bachelor of Business (HRM) and Masters of Business Administration (Corporate Governance & Strategy) and is a Certified Member and Mentor with the Australian Human Resources Institute.  She is also a member of the Corporate Leadership Council and Diversity Council Australia.

At home in the classroom, the newsroom and the boardroom, I am a firm believer that the pen, when used wisely and with measure, can and should inspire its audience.

jobs.description:
Write Results brings together two senior BD, marketing and communications specialists to help professional services firms, corporates and government agencies with their client communications, stakeholder communications and plain language writing and training needs.  

If you prepare written advice or reports, we can help you get better results.
We use plain language to boost commercial outcomes by helping you:
* Achieve the right results - by writing with a clear purpose for your audience, we focus decision-makers on key issues and recommendations.
* Get there faster - plain language will make it easier for your audience to understand what you’re saying. That saves everyone time and achieves results.
* Improve client satisfaction - your clients are busy people and will appreciate being able to get across your content and its purpose quickly.
* Create a competitive advantage - well-written documents will make you easier to work with. That makes you look good. That wins you new work and keeps your clients coming back.

Contact Sharon Stockman or me at https://writeresults.com.au/contact-us/

jobs.jobTitle: Researcher, Centre for Soviet and East European Studies
jobs.description:
As Perestroika-induced Gorbymania gave way to the shock therapy of Boris Yeltsin, this
      was an electrifying time to be studying the fall of the Soviet Union and the rise of
      
      Russia.

schools.description: King's CollegeMy Ph. D. thesis examined the use of political iconography in the last years of the Soviet Union and the first period of the Russian Federation. What was the popular attachment to the symbols, the places, and the memories of the past in modern Russia, and how did the government and opposition groups exploit these to legitimise their power and control in the turbulent Gorbachev / Yeltsin eras?

My Masters thesis explored the subject of guilt and repentance in modern Russia. Despite great suffering at the hands of its leaders and its neighbours, Russians found it very difficult to face up to their past and never had a reckoning with history.
I wrote my Honours thesis on the negotiation of the South Pacific Drift-Net Fishing Convention and how the small nations of the South Pacific united to avoid an impending environmental disaster.

Thesis: "The Fiction of Freedom: the Rise of the Czechoslovak Literary Reform Movement."How writers became the conscience of the Czech and Slovak nations - a threat that the Soviets violently crushed in 1968.

general.headline: Asia Pacific Managing Director at Baker & McKenzie
general.description:
I'm the Asia Pacific Managing Director of Baker McKenzie.

Baker McKenzie is one of the world's largest - and certainly the most widely recognised - law firms. As Managing Director of Asia Pacific, I'm involved in all aspects of the Firm's leadership and management across our 17 offices in Asia Pacific.

Previously I was the Managing Partner of Baker McKenzie's Australian offices. Before that I was a Partner and Chief Operating Officer of Gilbert + Tobin, Senior Adviser to the leadership team of the Chinese law firm King & Wood (now King & Wood Mallesons) and General Manager in Australia and New Zealand of global strategy consulting firm The Boston Consulting Group (BCG). Prior to those roles, I was a strategy consultant with BCG (in the US and Australia) and also a corporate lawyer with Freehills (now Herbert Smith Freehills).

I've always enjoyed being involved in community organisations and am currently Chair of the Sydney Film Festival (one of the world's oldest continuously running film festivals), Chair of the New South Wales Government's Film and Television Advisory Committee and a member of the Government's Arts and Culture Advisory Committee.

I've lived and worked in New York, Beijing, Melbourne and Sydney - and my current role sees me spend time working right across Asia Pacific. I'm passionate about gender diversity, the arts (especially film) and the Australian football team the Sydney Swans.

general.headline: Russian Translator at Blackmagic Design
general.description:
Translation and localization of the marketing and engineering texts from English to Russian. The text is covered but not limited to:
•	Advertisements (print and internet)
•	Subtitling
•	Product user manuals
•	Product web content
•	Press releases
•	Tweets / tiles / Facebook / product descriptions
•	User interfaces / localisation for hardware and software
•	Legal translations
•	Product technical specifications
•	Other marketing material 
•	Messages and official company emails from the CEO 
•	Trade show contents (banners, postcards, wall text etc.)
•	Company product catalogue

jobs.description:
Blackmagic Design translators undertake constant research as part of their work. It is critical that translators research thoroughly on the internet and through other resources available to them to ensure that they are using subject specific language that is also current and widely accepted by the target audience in the LOTE market. As part of this work translators in each language group also compile language-specific technical glossaries and in-house style guides for use of technical and marketing language in different contexts. These items are shared between translators in each language group to ensure that translations are consistent and coherent across BMD content. This research also includes BMD translators contacting and communicating with technical specialists working in fields relevant to the BMD products and participate in online forums where they seek clarification on any areas of uncertainty about language use.

In addition to this, BMD specialist staff such as product managers, engineers etc. run in-house training and product information sessions on a regular basis to BMD translators where they address and clarify product terminology and operation. These specialists are always accessible to translators for any one on one feedback and questions as well. Through these sessions BMD translators build contextual knowledge not just on products but also safety and legal knowledge surrounding the products and the production and broadcast industries.

Commonly translated materials include but are not limited to:
•	Advertisements (print and internet)
•	Subtitling
•	Product user manuals
•	Product web content
•	Press releases
•	Tweets / tiles / Facebook / product descriptions
•	User interfaces / localisation for hardware and software
•	Legal translations

It included all aspects of  content marketing, brand management, business development, annual budgeting, effective digital marketing, getting the most out of SEO and SEM campaigns and much more. I thrive on the diversity. A key part of the role involved developing and leading the marketing team and senior partners. It was vital that the entire team understandstood the firm's strategic marketing and BD plans and that we were all on the same page in the execution of the plan. Part of my job was to make it happen. Two components of the role I thoroughly enjoyed :

• Coaching upcoming associates and partners on their personal marketing strategies and business development skills, and
• Working with new practise groups to develop and execute strategies to help grow market share amongst newly identified target markets.

Internal communication and reporting is always important, but in my role, it was even more critical with it being a partnership owned firm. Overall, it was an immensely rewarding position with loads of responsibility for overseeing the marketing and BD today and into the future.

Marketing Agency specialising in Pharmaceutical Marketing.
      

    
      Worked on the Roche Avastin and Herceptin accounts.

general.headline: Principal at Write Results Pty Ltd
general.description:
I have worked in leading Australian professional services firms for more than 20 years. I specialise  in client and stakeholder communications, as well as plain language services. 

I have held communication, marketing and business development management positions at Ernst & Young, PricewaterhouseCoopers, BakerMcKenzie and Sparke Helmore Lawyers. For nine years, I also ran Write Results (Mark I). Before working in professional services, I worked in marketing roles at Penguin Books and a not-for-profit organisation. I have also been a guest lecturer in Applied Communications at RMIT. 

I fill my days off to the brim with family, friends and fun stuff – like walking (in beautiful places), sailing (in safe harbours) and surfing (on tame beaches). I'm also ridiculously pleased that my kids know how to use possessive apostrophes.

jobs.description:
Write Results brings together two senior BD, marketing and communications specialists to help professional services firms, corporates and government agencies with their client communications, stakeholder communications and plain language writing and training needs. 

If you prepare written advice or reports, we can help you get better results.

We use plain language to boost commercial outcomes by helping you:
* Achieve the right results - by writing with a clear purpose for your audience, we focus decision-makers on key issues and recommendations.
* Get there faster - plain language will make it easier for your audience to understand what you’re saying. That saves everyone time and achieves results.
* Improve client satisfaction - your clients are busy people and will appreciate being able to get across your content and its purpose quickly.
* Create a competitive advantage - well-written documents will make you easier to work with. That makes you look good. That wins you new work and keeps your clients coming back.

Contact me or Elizabeth Gray at https://writeresults.com.au/contact-us/

In 1998, I founded Write Results Communications Pty Ltd, a corporate communications consultancy specialising in the professional services sector.  The business, which began as a freelance model with one client, grew quickly.  By 2003, Write Results employed three consultants, operated from a studio in Yarraville and provided a full range of corporate communications services, including proposal writing, strategic external and internal communications, communications project management, business writing, editing and proofreading.  

Write Results had more than 50 corporate clients including: PricewaterhouseCoopers, Ernst & Young, Baker McKenzie, Minter Ellison, Mallesons, Corrs, Maurice Blackburn, many second tier law and accounting firms, the Victorian Government Solicitor’s Office, the NSW Premier’s Department, the Legal Practice Board, Computershare, Sensis, CSIRO, Mercantile Mutual (now ING) and eSign.

This one-year contract provided an exciting opportunity to manage the state-based
      marketing functions of a multi-national professional services firm. This role reported
      operationally to the Melbourne Managing Partner and strategically to the National
      
      Marketing Director.

jobs.description:
50% of my role involves supporting a small team of busy Consultants in an administrative capacity while the other 50% of my time is taken up performing various training and development functions for the whole Naiman Clarke office.   

In the capacity of Paraconsultant my responsibilities more specifically include:
•  Creating and posting quality job ads to multiple job boards in a timely fashion.  
•  Constantly updating and maintaining the internal recruitment database. 
•  Performing reference checks, often speaking with Lawyers, Barristers and Partners and subsequently writing up a reference report.
•  Creating candidate summaries and reformatting or updating candidate CV's. 
•  Various research projects into the job market, market salaries and sourcing candidates. 
•  Many other adhoc administration tasks, as required.

The other half of my role as the company's Training and Development Administrator involves:
•  Preparing contracts, commission structures and other related documents
•  Tracking new employees probationary review periods and preparing end of probation letters 
•  Preparing and coordinating the induction program for all new starters. 
•  Conducting training sessions for all new starters spanning administration, database training, drafting of documents and protocols etc.  
•  Creating and updating resources to assist in training and understanding of new systems and processes. 
•  Liaising with external parties to coordinate specialised staff training sessions. 
•  Ensuring the continued professional development support for all staff through liaising with the Managing Director and coordinating required development programs of courses.

•	Advertising jobs on SEEK and co-coordinating interviews on behalf of various contract managers.
•	Liaising with clients and co-workers working on the Foreign Commonwealth Offices contract to update and maintain their database know as Pyramid.
•	Successfully liaising with numerous contractors, site staff and finance to ensure invoices are processed efficiently. 
•	Acting as first point of contact via email and phone for staff, clients and contractors.
•	Ad-hoc admin tasks as requested.

jobs.description:
At Legal Home Loans we deal exclusively with lawyers. 

As a lawyer you may be unaware that certain banks perceive you as a lower risk client and offer specialist products only available to your industry. Whether you currently own property and wish to secure a better rate, expand your investment portfolio or set up your own law practice we can assist.

We know that your time is precious and we know your time is money. We endeavour to be flexible for this reason and hold the majority of our client meetings outside conventional business hours. 

Don't get caught with your local broker who doesn't know anything about your line of work and don't get stuck with a bank that won't tell you about a better deal around the corner. 

Look forward to hearing from you!

I am an experienced lawyer with global management  experience. For more than 30 years I have been a trusted adviser to boards and senior executives, including General Counsel, on disputes of strategic importance, especially in the telecommunications sector, and a key legal adviser to insolvency practitioners and financial institutions.

I am the Chair, Australian offices, immediate past chairman Asia Pacific Region, Baker McKenzie and a former member of the Executive Committee, the team that manages the Firm's 77 offices in 47 countries. While Chair of the Asia Pacific Region, I lived in Singapore.

I also have senior corporate executive experience, gained during my time as General Counsel at SingTel Optus, in a period that saw the company's IPO, the "tech boom", the "tech wreck" and the SingTel takeover.

I also have a deep interest and management experience in arts and heritage organisations.

jobs.description: Baker McKenzie has more than 13,000 people of over 60 nationalities in 78 offices in 47 countries. I was responsible for implementing the Firm strategy in Asia Pacific. I was deeply involved in the Firm's India, Korea and Myanmar strategies.

      twofold:  first, strategic litigation for corporations involved in a variety of industries
      including telecommunications, IT, media, financial services and aviation; second,
      
      corporate restructuring and insolvency.

SingTel Optus services over 10 million customers a day. I reported directly to the CEO, attended all board meetings and managed a legal team of about 40 people. While at Optus I gained invaluable senior management experience and was responsible for the legal aspects of a number of key projects including the IPO and the takeover by SingTel which is one of the largest transactions in Australia’s corporate history.

I was managing partner of Minter Ellison in Sydney for about three years, which then had 430 people including 50 partners and 150 other lawyers. I introduced a number of initiatives including Total Quality Management (TQM) into the Sydney office to improve client service and project management. I oversaw significant revenue growth for the Sydney office during this period.

general.headline: Partner at Baker & McKenzie
general.description:
Martijn Wilder AM
martijn.wilder@bakermckenzie.com 
+61 414 863 313.

Martijn is head of Baker and McKenzie’s Global Environmental Markets practice specialising in climate change, international carbon and broader environmental markets, conservation finance and conservation projects. His other roles include Professor of Climate Change Law at the Australian National University. Martijn is Chair of the Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) and President of WWF (Australia). He is Director of  the Climate Council. He holds advisory roles as Chair of the NSW Climate Change Council, a Governing Board Member of the Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Partnership (REEEP) and as a member of the Wentworth Group of Concerned Scientists. He is also the Deputy Chair of the Private Sector Roundtable of the Asia Pacific Rainforest Recovery Plan and on the Commonwealth Government's Reef Trust Innovative Financial Mechanisms Panel. Martijn previously served as a Director of the Clean Energy Finance Corporation and previously chaired the Independent Review Committee of the Victorian Climate Change Act. He was formerly Chairman of Low Carbon Australia and for many years chaired TRAFFIC (Oceania). He has written widely especially on climate change law, environmental law and Antarctica. In 2012, Martijn was awarded a Member of the Order of Australia in recognition for "service to environmental law, particularly in the area of climate change through contributions to the development of law, global regulation, public policy and the promotion of public debate, and to the community".

allSkills: Climate Change, Renewable Energy, Public Policy, Sustainable Development, Sustainability, Corporate Social Responsibility, Business Strategy, Carbon

general.headline: COO of BBC Studios, Aust & NZ
general.description:
At BBC Studios, I am responsible for business development & new business, strategy, operations, IT, legal & business affairs and key corporate / commercial deal negotiations. I am on BBC's Global Leadership Team. 

Last year I was awarded a scholarship from Chief Executive Women to study leadership at INSEAD. Since this time I followed up with further study at INSEAD, earning an INSEAD Distinction Award for Digital Innovation (2018). 

Since 2016, I have serviced as a non-executive director of UN Women. In 2018, I was also appointed to the board of Football NSW and Friends of The Australian Ballet's advisory council committee for marketing and events.

Previously, I worked in corporate mergers and acquisitions at Herbert Smith Freehills and Gilbert + Tobin where I advised international, ASX listed, private equity funds as well as private and government organisations in all sectors. I also worked at Hogan Lovells in Berlin. 

Along the way I founded a start up business back in 2006 and sold my business in 2012. 

In my spare time, I act as a mentor for Sydney University start up program, Incumbate, I teach Latin Ballroom dancing and am prone to say yes and sign up to sporty challenges that I should probably know better at my age!

In all things I do, fair to say that I know the work needed to achieve results and that I thrive leading high performance teams to achieve outstanding result

general.headline: Speaker - Athlete - Writer
general.description:
Corporate lawyer turned international endurance athlete, inspirational speaker and social change advocate.  

In my final years as a law student I embraced a 'once in a life time' opportunity to race 250kms in the driest desert in the world - the Atacama Desert in Chile. Despite all of the formal education and experiences I had to this point, it was through the preparation and 6 days of the race that I learnt some of my most invaluable life lessons on resilience, adaptability and bravery. 

 That same year I became the first woman & youngest person to complete the Four Deserts Grandslam - 4 x 250km ultra marathons in the driest, windiest, hottest and coldest deserts on earth. Through this journey I was featured in the award-winning documentary Desert Runners that highlights the need for resilience in immensely challenging situations and hostile surroundings. 

Through exploration of other communities & landscapes all over the world, I have deepened my own understanding of my mental and physical capacities. I have discovered that our capabilities are often beyond our imagination but the power is when we can use the thing we are passionate about, for a purpose outside of ourselves - achieved through collaboration and mindfulness. 

I drew from these experiences in my work as a corporate lawyer and now in my position as a speaker,  endurance athlete, writer & Ambassador for World Vision.  

In 2014, I ran 1968kms across South Africa over 32 day to raise funds and awareness around the high cost and inaccessibility of feminine hygiene products for women in rural South Africa. 
In 2016, I partnered with World Vision on its 50th anniversary for a 3253kms from the west to east of India over 77 days.  Raising over $150K to fund six education programs across India and creating a digital awareness campaign around the educational needs of children in India

jobs.description:
Notably: 

2010 - First woman & youngest person at the time to complete Racing the Planet's 4 Deserts Grandslam. 4 x 250km desert ultramarathons in the driest (Chile), windiest (China), hottest (Egypt) and coldest (Antarctica). 

2011 - La Ultra: The High, 222kms nonstop between the two highest motorable passes (India)

2012 - 379km nonstop crossing of Australia's Simpson Desert 

2014 - 1968km, 32 day run across South Africa's Freedom Trail. 

2015 - XPD: Australia's Expedition Race, 700km adventure race in Townsville. 

2016 - 3253km, 76 day run from West to East of India.

As an internationally recognised endurance athlete, keynote presenter and executive coach, I build on my professional training as a qualified lawyer and performing arts honours graduate. In doing so, I provide a valuable combination of professional and sporting insight to engage professionals to achieve success by pushing within achievable limits to maximise business and personal objectives.

I am passionate and excited to help business, individuals and teams push through their limitations and achieve greater success - inside and outside the office.

The topics I present on: 
- A Story About Life Beyond The Comfort Zone. 
- Passion, Purpose and Preparation
- The Key To Endurance: long-term self belief, adaptability and the capacity for relentless forward motion. 
- Winning The Mind Game: how to build mental resilience and determination. 
- Performing Teams: how to lead and be a member of a highly functional team.
- Women In Leadership: succeeding and thriving in a male dominated sport.

The vision of impossible2Possible (i2P) is to use adventure to cultivate a generation of leaders, whose direct experiences and education will prepare them to lead social and environmental action all across the world. To achieve this, i2P utilises a combination of world-class expeditions, youth expeditions, leadership training and fully interactive web based educational resource material. 

I was a member of the Expedition Team for i2P Botswana. As eight youth ambassadors ran 400kms across the Kalahari Desert and through a Partnership with Simon Fraser University we created a captivating curriculum centered on the topic of 'Water and its Effect on Human Development and Biodiversity'. This content was then delivered to class rooms all over the world using interactive Internet/satellite technology and enlisting the active participation of students.

Nutrition Plus is an Australia wide charity whose purpose is to improve the health of Indigenous Children. They achieve this through: 
- Engaging children, their parents, teachers and community through school programs
- Providing funding for school fruit, vegetable and bush-tucker gardens
- Incorporating produce from their gardens into breakfast & lunch programs & cooking lessons
- Providing whole food supplementation with our product of choice – Juice Plus+
- Encouraging increased consumption of fruits & vegetables through education

Launched in 2011, the League of Extraordinary Women (LEAGUE) was Australia's fastest growing organisation for young female entrepreneurs. The LEAGUE hosts motivating and inspiring -  evening and breakfast events and the annual Run the World Event, where members and guests learn from Australia's most successful female entrepreneurs.  Samantha has spoken on all platforms as the LEAGUE's National Crusader from 2011 - 2014.

Wealth Enhancers is a boutique private wealth management firm with offices in Melbourne and Sydney. We are a fee-for-service firm, providing financial advice based on your personal goals and values, essentially what is most important to you in your life. Our clients are primarily high income earning young professionals, sporting professionals and those approaching retirement.

general.headline: Consultant at Sigma Executive
general.description:
Kristina is a consultant at Sigma Executive recruiting senior lawyers in private practice and in-house across Australia. In another life, Kristina worked as a commercial real estate lawyer at Baker McKenzie and in corporate tax at PwC. 

Kristina understands lawyers and law firms. She is focused on helping lawyers achieve their goals and helping clients by bringing the best people together to form high performing, collegiate and happy teams that thrive.

One of Kristina’s key strengths is her thorough knowledge of the legal industry and extensive network resulting from her previous roles. Her experience is diverse, ranging from the private sector, government and community service within the property, construction and financial services industries.

jobs.description:
At Sigma Executive, we’re more than a leading executive search firm. As experienced legal professionals, we also understand your world. We make it our business to know exactly what you need from your legal talent and we make it happen.

Our secret weapon? Partnerships. 

Not many – we don’t claim to partner with every firm. We have strong and deep relationships with a select group of law firms who are aligned with our organisational ethos. 

Our clients understand the importance of finding, selecting and retaining the finest senior lawyers in the market. And our expert knowledge and extensive networks ensure we are well placed to do just that. We’re here to build your capability, as a trusted advisor and partner – empowering you to attract and retain exceptional talent. 

How do we differentiate ourselves? We take the time to really get to know and understand your business and the lawyers we represent. Our competitive advantage comes from our boutique size and the depth of our experience, which allows us to deliver a premium level of service with flexibility and consistency. 

We work carefully and confidentially to uncover the top performing leaders in the legal space – accomplished, highly-motivated senior lawyers with gravitas and big aspirations. 

Our focus: introduce the best people to the best opportunities – then watch the magic happen.

Kristina has broad experience advising on a range of real estate matters including acquisitions, dispositions and leaseback arrangements for commercial, industrial, retail and agricultural property, commercial and retail leasing, residential development work and general real estate advice (largely Australia-wide).

Kristina also has previous experience in the corporate, environmental markets, dispute resolution and construction areas.

general.headline: Political philosopher, human rights advocate
general.description:
Dr Tim Soutphommasane is a human rights advocate and political philosopher. From 2013 to 2018 he was Australia’s Race Discrimination Commissioner, and during that time twice led the successful defence of federal racial discrimination laws against repeal or amendment. He has held academic 
posts at The University of Sydney and Monash University. His thinking on multiculturalism, national identity and patriotism has been influential in shaping debates in Australia and Britain.

Tim is the author of four books, I’m Not Racist But … (2015), The Virtuous Citizen (2012), Don't Go Back To Where You Came From (2012), and Reclaiming Patriotism (2009). He was co-editor (with Nick Dyrenfurth) of All That's Left (2010). He has been an opinion columnist with The Age and The Weekend Australian newspapers, and in 2013 presented the documentary series “Mongrel Nation” on ABC Radio National. He was awarded a NSW Premier's Literary Award in 2013 for Don't Go Back To Where You Came From, and a UN Media Award in 2013 for Mongrel Nation. 

A first-generation Australian, Tim was raised in southwest Sydney. He completed a Doctor of Philosophy and Master of Philosophy (with distinction) at the University of Oxford, and is a first-class honours graduate of The University of Sydney.

jobs.jobTitle: Senior Legal Adviser - Innovation, Technology and Transformation
jobs.description:
Senior Legal Adviser in the Innovation, Technology and Transformation team for Bupa Legal ANZ.  

Provided legal support to all the different businesses within Bupa Australia Group including the private health insurance, aged care services, health services, migration and visa services businesses on various technology and business development related contracting matters to support the growth of the businesses.

Responsibilities included:

- Drafting, reviewing and negotiating all types of technology and commercial contracts (including but not limited to master services agreements, outsourcing contracts, managed services agreements, systems integration agreements, software licence agreements, software-as-a-service agreements, back-to-back subcontracts, leases, sponsorship agreements, construction contracts, collaboration agreements and research agreements) for all parts of the Bupa Australia Group business.

- Advising and assisting the health insurance business with major IT projects i.e. the IT transformation project and providing legal support during the RFP process including drafting a modular ITMSA, assisting business with ranking tenderer responses and conducting parallel negotiations with downselected systems integrators and finalising the agreements.  

- Providing timely and sound legal advice on contract law issues and regulatory obligations to various parts of the Bupa Australia Group business.

- Developing and updating precedent agreements and ensuring that various parts of the businesses have such precedents as are necessary to cover the range of business activities contemplated and that the precedents are up to date with current law and user friendly for commercial managers.

Secondment at PEXA (formerly known as NECDL), a dynamic start up technology firm formed in 2010 to fulfill a government agenda item to deliver a national electronic conveyancing solution to the Australian property industry that will revolutionise the way that property transactions are conducted.

Responsibilities included:
-Advising on various regulatory issues under the Model Participation Rules and Model Operating Requirements for proposed business activities.

- Drafting and reviewing various template agreements for different subscribers ie financial institutions, legal practitioners and conveyancers. 
	
- Reviewing and negotiating a variety of contracts relating to the supply and procurement of IT products and services from various vendors. 

- Participating in contract discussions with State Revenue offices, Land Registries and major financial institutions ie the big 4 banks.

- Reviewing internal documentation prepared by internal stakeholders, advising on commercial and legal risks.

jobs.jobTitle: Lawyer, Technology, Media and Telecommunications (TMT) team
jobs.description:
Non-contentious IP/IT experience
•	Drafting, reviewing and negotiating a variety of contracts relating to the supply and procurement of IT products and services such as software licences, managed services agreements, website hosting agreements, service level agreements, reseller agreements and advising clients in relation to legal issues arising from such contracts, including termination rights, limitation of liability, indemnities, KPIs and dispute mechanisms.
•	Assisting Corporate team with the drafting, negotiating and finalising of transitional services agreements for two high value corporate transactions.  
•	Drafting and advising on various contracts in relation to the commercialisation of various technology including internet applications developed by start up companies.
•	Reviewing, amending and “localising” foreign IT contracts for international clients to ensure compliance with Australian law.
•	Advising client on the conduct of negotiations of distribution agreements with tenderers and participating in the negotiations.
•	Drafting termination notices, deeds of variation, contract extension letters, reviewing and updating Statements of Work for client.
•	Preparing software integration and implementation and support agreements, deed of novation of intellectual property for pro bono clients. 


Contentious IP experience
•	Acting for an iconic global technology company in a software patent opposition matter before the Australian Patents Office.
o	Attending and conducting interviews with expert witness.
o	Reviewing complex technology patents to assist in identifying relevant prior art to the opposed software patent application.
o	Briefing counsel and participating in strategy discussions with counsel in relation to preparation of evidence-in-support of opposition.
o	Assisting senior lawyers in drafting and finalising sections of expert’s declaration as evidence-in-support of opposition.

Part time secondment (2 days a week) at the Melbourne Cricket Club.

Responsibilities included:

•	Drafting, vetting and negotiating a variety of contracts including consultancy services agreements, venue access agreements, confidentiality agreements, reseller agreements, MOUs, sponsorship and corporate suite licence agreements and advising client on issues arising from such contracts, including but not limited to liability, exclusion of consequential loss, termination rights, KPIs, service levels, indemnities and intellectual property issues.
•	Assisting with reviewing and updating standard form contracts including standard form services agreements, confidentiality agreements, tour agent reseller agreements, loan and donation documentation.   
•	Assisting with finalisation of tender documentation for various infrastructure and technology upgrade projects being undertaken at the Melbourne Cricket Ground and preparing draft services agreements to be issued to tenderers.
•	Providing legal advice on a wide variety of issues including contract interpretation, statutory interpretation and legal implications of proposed business activities.
•	Assisting in ensuring that the business is complying with legislative and regulatory requirements by regularly checking legal updates that affects the business and sending updates to relevant stakeholders, attending legislative compliance catch up meetings with various senior stakeholders from the business and assisting in developing policies for Australian Consumer Law and intellectual property compliance.
•	Managing delegation of work requiring specialist advice to external lawyers at Ashurst Australia and keeping client informed of work progress.
•	Dealing with correspondence from external sources.

Back end (contentious/litigation) experience

•	Acting for the head contractor (as defendant in Supreme Court Victoria proceedings and plaintiff in subsequent arbitration proceedings following successful stay application) in a large computer software development for the State of Victoria in relation to the IT systems that underpin the Victorian court system.  
•	Acting for the Defendant in a commercial dispute in the Supreme Court of Victoria Commercial Court.  

Litigation skills include:
o	Drafting and preparing key court documents such as pleadings (Statement of Claim, Defence etc), submissions and lay witness statements;
o	Legal research;  
o	Attending and conducting witness interviews with key factual witnesses;
o	Preparing cross examination bundles and briefs for Counsel;
o	Preparing brief for expert witness; 
o	Providing assistance to instructing lawyers during arbitration proceedings.

•	Assisting in advising a contractor for a design and construct project in relation to EOT claims.
•	Assisting in advising a tunnel boring machine equipment supplier for a major toll road project in relation to claims made by the Head Contractor.
•	Assisting in advising client architect/engineering companies on a range of variations and latent conditions claims.

Front end (non contentious) experience
•	Assisting in advising Unisuper (as project company) for the billion dollar Victorian Comprehensive Cancer Centre PPP Project, conducting due diligence of Project documentation to analyse and prepare summaries on key risk gaps between Head Agreement and D&C Contract and subcontract.   
•	Assisting supplier on bids for supply only contracts for various mining, energy and resources projects by reviewing draft contracts and preparing table of bid departures reflecting supplier’s preferred risk allocation.  
•	Assisting in advising architects on the drafting of variation deeds to address copyright issues and reviewing design and consultancy services agreements.

•	Paralegal with the Transactions team, providing legal advice to bankers in the VIC, NT, SA and TAS regions.
•	Perusing trust deeds to determine trustee powers.
•	Preparing weekly legal newsletter by summarising and linking updates emailed by Bank’s Panel law firms for the legal department.
•	Perusing leases (to determine commerciality of lease terms) and subdivision plans/easements before issuing Bank’s consent as mortgagor.
•	Preparing documentation such as deeds of subordination and priority to secure the bank’s priority as a creditor over other creditors.

general.headline: Senior Associate at MinterEllison
general.description:
Rob is a Senior Associate in the Minter Ellison HR/IR team and has over 10 years’ post-admission experience, practising in both Perth and Sydney. 

Rob has extensive experience providing employers in the mining and resources, government, telecommunications and professional services sectors with commercial and strategic advice on all aspects of employment law, including business restructuring, performance and conduct management, internal HR investigations and termination of employees and executives.  

Rob specialises in assisting employers to manage the exit of senior executives whilst protecting their confidential information and commercial interests, including advising on applications for injunctions to enforce restraint of trade and non-competition clauses.  Rob also has expertise in assisting employers investigate and manage Whistleblower and Public Interest Disclosures whilst ensuring compliance with all relevant legal obligations.

Rob also has a strong health and safety focus, including providing advice on serious safety incident management and response, regulatory and internal incident investigations and resulting regulator prosecutions and civil litigation.

Rob has represented employers in the Fair Work Commission, Industrial Relations Commissions, Federal Circuit Court, Supreme Courts of WA and NSW and the Federal Court, including acting in post-employment restraint of trade and breach of contract litigation, unfair dismissal and adverse action proceedings.  Rob has also acted for employers in industrial relations disputes, including negotiating with unions on enterprise agreements and related industrial action.

Between 2014 and 2017, Rob has undertaken various periods on secondment as in-house Senior Legal Counsel at nbn co limited, which required him to provide pragmatic and commercial employment and WHS advice in the fast-moving and high-profile nbn environment.

general.description:
Nathan is a leading Australian investment lawyer and wellbeing expert. He has a long history of building businesses and innovating in the venture capital, private equity, investment, finTech, wellbeing and health industries. 

He works with major fund managers and financial institutions, large family offices and investors in relation to business strategy, launching their new ventures and making investments. He has launched businesses in the gym, weight loss and investment industries and has a strong background in wellbeing including meditation, fitness, nutrition and health.

Nathan has received numerous industry accolades.

Nathan is lauded for his commercial accumen and pragmatic approach. In particular, he is well regarded for his trusted guidance on financial services business strategy and product design.

Motivated by the challenges of the modern corporate life such as stress, depression and try to maintain health and fitness, Nathan founded iWithin (operates also as Wythin: www.iwithin.com) which helps people redesign their lives to find their winning formula to a life that matters most to them. Nathan speaks to major businesses and their employees on how to implement a game plan to achieve a better life based on over 20 years of research and know how to make successful long term life change.

jobs.description: Specialist Investment Lawyer

jobs.companyName: AVCAL - Australian Private Equity and Venture Capital Association Limited

jobs.description:
At iWithin we are inspired by those that have overcome life's challenges to live an inspiring life.

We wanted to bottle whatever it was that helped these people succeed at life’s game so each of us could get our daily dose and live the lives we were made for.   After all, the failure rate for most in making life changes, like getting fit, losing weight and conquering stress is 90% or more. So how is it that some succeed and some don't? 

So we studied those that have succeeded, years of scientific research and ancient spiritual wisdom to work out that there is actually a formula to these successes. We also found out that most people fail because they don't know what their formula for success is and they only ever employ a few parts of this formula  - plus people struggle to find the time and keep it up. 

So iWithin helps you make the changes in your life that matter most to you by helping you work out your winning formula and helping you fit it in and keep it up in our busy and demanding world. 

We want everyone to live the life they were made for.

                                                                 *******************

There is a place deep within so quiet and calm that is always so; so strong and knowing that it feels like home; where our wounds and shadows lose their grip; and where our potential is limitless and our dreams live strong

Feel it

Own it

Live it

Go Within...

general.headline: Senior Associate at Corrs Chambers Westgarth
general.description:
I didn’t start out as a lawyer.  My first fulltime job was at Logan City Council as its initial Environment Officer.  Based in the Engineering Department, I had the opportunity to build up the Council’s environmental program and to work with a great group of people who wanted to make a practical difference.

After some time at Council, I started studying law at night and over weekends and holidays.  I graduated ‘top of my class’.  But after over 12 years at Council, it was time to pursue a legal career.

I now have over 15 years of experience in the rail, energy and resources and government sectors.  I’ve had a significant focus on rail and linear transport infrastructure including regulated access, safety, leasing, tenure and land access and related mining and petroleum compensation and access arrangements.

However, I’m more than just a “rail lawyer”.  I’ve undertaken secondments at various State Government Departments, Vale and Aurizon Network Pty Ltd.  I’ve advised on various other types of matters – e.g. GOC competitive neutrality, licencing arrangements for 2001: A Space Odyssey, sugar sales, co-mingling and storage agreements, a hospital energy facility BOOT arrangement, indoor cricket affiliation and sponsorship agreements, harbour and premise leasing, CSO agreements and resumption issues, just to name a few.

My move from the Energy Resources and Projects group at Corrs to the Intellectual Property, Technology and Competition group in recent years has expanded my horizons – exposing me to a broader competition law practice and issues such as privacy, telecommunications, AI and robotics.  However, I haven't seen practice groups as work silos, as I've often had the chance to work for, and with, other partners and groups.

While I’ve always been interested in science fiction and what the future might hold, my head isn’t in the clouds.  I’ve learnt a lot from my career so far, including the value of hard work, adaptability and an open, creative, positive mind.

jobs.description:
I joined Corrs in January 2003 after completing my university studies.  I completed my law degree with the highest GPA in my graduating year and subsequently received a University Medal and was awarded the KG Copp Memorial Prize and a Queensland Law Society Prize.

While at Corrs, I have advised on various aspects of infrastructure access and development (including regulated third party access), land access, mining, petroleum and energy specific issues as well as general corporate issues.  I have acted for a wide variety of clients but in particular clients from the rail, mining, petroleum, energy and government sectors.

I developed a strong environmental program for the Council across a broad range of policy areas including education, environmental planning and management, vegetation protection, land acquisition, waterways management, greenhouse gas abatement and heritage conservation.  My last position at Logan City Council was as the Legal and Policy Coordinator (1 year 5 months) in the Environment Services Branch.  This reflected my increasing focus on the provision of advice on legal matters and higher level policy coodination.

I principally assisted Dr Carla Catterall with various database and research tasks.  I also
      assisted in preparing materials for the "Brisbane City Natural Areas Management

general.headline: Head of HR at Dulux Group | Culture Change Specialist | Organisational Psychologist
general.description:
I’m a culture change specialist with a vision to make workplaces better. I have a track record of creating healthier, happier and more productive businesses across four continents. My work has been featured as a case study at Harvard Business School by the change management guru, Professor John Kotter. 

I’m an Organisational Psychologist by background and spent the first decade of my career as a management consultant advising leaders across Europe, Asia, the United States and Australia about how to manage change. 

Following this decade as a change advisor I decided I wanted some ‘skin in the game’. I joined a series of large organisations as the senior executive in charge of change. In these roles I rolled up my sleeves and worked as a company ‘insider’ to successfully implement transformational shifts and business turnarounds. 

I am currently the Executive General Manager of Human Resources at DuluxGroup which is an international paints and coatings company (headquartered in Melbourne, Australia). The key focus in my role is helping to create a more innovative, consumer driven and growth oriented culture. 

My name Siobhan is pronounced ‘Shiv-awn’ which is the Irish form of Joan. 

Please connect with me on LinkedIn if you are interested in workplace culture and change.

Oh and the English sheepdog in my profile picture? His name is Digby and he is the brand ambassador for Dulux Group.

My specialist skills are:
- Culture Change
- Change Management
- Organisation Effectiveness
- Leadership Development
- Diversity & Inclusion 
- Employee Engagement
- Learning Strategy & Design
- Performance Management
- Talent Management 
- Succession Planning

general.headline: Partner and Co-founder at Fifth Frame
general.description:
I have spent 30 years consulting to organisations around the World about issues connecting their people to their business results.  The past few years my focus has sharpened on leadership and culture and the importance  of those two connected concepts for organisational survival as the world of work is significantly disrupted by technology in the next five to ten years.  

To be successful the best businesses, governments and not-for-profits will have to help their workforce navigate the collision of rapidly accelerating technology capability with thousands of years of human evolution and hundreds of years of slowly developed societal norms.  The answer is not black and white, our personal and collective future prosperity lies in how we choose to navigate these coming years of turmoil.

After twenty years working in global consulting businesses and partnerships and spending increasing amounts of time on internal and management tasks I am now focused on bringing the people expertise of Fifth Frame directly to clients.

jobs.description:
Fifth Frame is an Australian-based management consulting business which focuses on helping business and government bodies achieve success through their people.

Our clients range from small, nimble app developers to government infrastructure businesses, from big four banks to leading media organisations.  In short, anyone.  Because people issues are mostly solved by knowing how people tick, by understanding psychology and behavioural economics, and by applying deep academic research and years of practical experience; not complex models, toolkits or industry frameworks. 

There are some problems that require an army of consultants working on a "transformation" agenda, but more often we see the need for ongoing advice and counsel from a trusted partner.  If you are looking for an organisation to work with over the long term, to help you achieve the results you have been looking for, by getting the most out of your people then you might just have come to the right place...
www.fifthframe.com.au

Guiding and directing our Global network of close to 11,000 Partners and staff in the People and Organisation practice.  Bringing  together an un-matched combination of people in 138 countries with industry, mobility, business, talent, strategy, HR, analytics and technology expertise in one team.  Together we build tailored people and organisation solutions, with a deep understanding of each clients’ uniqueness and grounded in rigorous analysis and data-driven insight, to create lasting, differentiated value.  We help clients to implement organisational transformation, improve the effectiveness of their workforce, develop and move talent around their business and manage their human capital risks. We work from people strategy through to organisational execution.

PwC's Australian People business helps our clients to realise and discover the potential of their people…. by providing a single integrated people consulting and solutions service. Our services range from payroll and immigration solutions, through employment taxes and industrial relations advice to change management, organisation design, remuneration and leadership and culture consulting - and all points inbetween.

Gallup has a great range of well researched tools for connecting employees to their
      potential, primarily through their Q12 employee survey and their strengths approach.
      Occasionally organisations can be overtaken by an almost religious belief in things that
      
      are really just models reflecting reality, not actually reality itself.

A handful of us started and grew the Hewitt Associates business in Australia and New Zealand from nothing to a sizeable player in the Australian HR consulting market. From our offices in the Rocks in Sydney and in Melbourne, Auckland and Wellington we focused mainly on measuring and driving employee engagement for our clients. The "Best Employer....." Awards were the first of their kind in this market and a particular breakthrough in terms of driving organisations to recognise the importance of engagement in driving business outcomes.

Started out trying to apply a psychology degree somewhere and ended up in the executive remuneration space, firstly in Croydon with Noble Lowndes and then in Sydney with Cullen Egan Dell when an opportunity arose there. Exec rem is a great starting point for understanding organisations, roles and individual drivers of behaviour.

general.headline: Workplace Wellbeing Expert ✔Author ✔Coach ✔Teacher  Bringing out the best in people at work.
general.description:
My name is Michelle McQuaid, and I'm a best-selling author, workplace wellbeing teacher and playful change activator. With more than a decade of senior leadership experience in large organizations around the world, I'm passionate about translating cutting-edge research from positive psychology and neuroscience, into practical strategies for growth, wellbeing, and business success. 

Your primary source of business productivity is a team of engaged, motivated, healthy employees who genuinely care for your customers, support their colleagues, and add real value to your stakeholders.  Furthermore, employees who learn how to bring out the best in themselves find their goals easier to achieve, get better performance reviews, find more meaning in their work and are less likely to burn out.

I hold a Masters in Applied Positive Psychology from the University of Pennsylvania and am an honorary fellow at Melbourne University’s Graduate School of Education, and because I believe that playfulness is essential for growth, everything I deliver is designed to share serious knowledge and skills in a playful way that accelerates learning and make changes so enjoyable they last.

My books, training programs, coaching sessions and talks have already helped thousands of people make work more rewarding, and my blend of real-world successes, actionable advice and enthusiasm are why I'm sought out by audiences around the world at organizations that include PwC, IBM, GlaxoSmithKline, the Australian Grand Prix, National Australia Bank, MLC Insurance, Treasury Wine Estates, the Australian Human Resources Institute, Ravenswood Girls School, the VIA Institute and many more. 

I live to help people discover their strengths, move beyond their fears, and finally discover what it truly takes to flourish with confidence. Let me show you how.

☛ Learn more at:

http://www.michellemcquaid.com 【 ツ】

☛ For media opportunities, please contact:

chelle@michellemcquaid.com 【 ツ】

jobs.jobTitle: Positive Business Trainer - Playful Design Facilitator ✔ Mentor ✔ Executive Consultant
jobs.description:
I completed my Masters in Applied Positive Psychology (MAPP) at the University of Pennsylvania with Martin Seligman, the field’s founder, who recognized me as as "one of the world’s leaders in designing and delivering positive psychology interventions in workplaces."  Alongside Marty, I imparted this knowledge and skill to leading CEOs across Australia and opened their minds to ways they can bring out the best in their employees.
 
I’ve had a blast improving levels of engagement by delivering positive psychology training programs, boosting productivity by aligning HR processes to strengths and fuelling behavior changes by teaching leaders and their teams to maximize tools like Appreciative Inquiry and Playful Design (sometimes referred to as gamification).

☛ Want to know more?  Check out:

 www.michellemcquaid.com 【 ツ】

I am committed to furthering the conversation about how we make workplaces better for employees, their bosses and their organizations. If you’re interested in talking don’t hesitate to contact Michelle for media opportunities at:

I provide real estate advice to clients such as reviewing and advising on landholding and other tenure issues, title consolidation, title affectations and other forms of property advice. I also have experience in conducting and reporting on large due diligence projects. 

I act for government, Optus and other corporations in the telecommunications industry advising on all property-related aspects of mobile network deployment including advising on leasing, licensing and facilities management as well as advising on broader strategic planning. I also act for the Commonwealth Bank of Australia and other blue chip companies advising on commercial leasing matters associated with their corporate offices and retail premises. 

I am involved in MinterEllison's pro-bono and community investment initiatives and have been involved in other committees, including sitting on the firm's Junior Lawyer's Committee and Pro-Bono Committee and coordinating two community investment programs 'Show Me The Way' (a national online mentoring program supporting Aboriginal students) and 'Lawyers Encouraging and Assisting Promising Student' (a mentoring program for promising adolescents from disadvantaged schools and communities).  

I am a member of the Property Council's '100 Women in Property' initiative and I participate in the ABCN 'Accelerate' program (a mentoring and financial scholarship program for exceptional yet disadvantaged students).

I provided legal services to several of Optus' business units (and other related group entities). These included marketing, product and customer groups. I monitored changes in legal and regulatory requirements and developed appropriate strategies for compliance. I also advised on advertising and other promotional material associated with product launches, campaigns and promotion.
I assisted with review of continuing professional development compliance.

I completed rotations in Intellectual Property, Human Resources and Industrial
      
      Relations and Finance.

general.headline: Senior Recruitment Consultant, Legal at Carlyle Kingswood Global
general.description:
Najeeb is a Senior Consultant in the Legal In-house team at Carlyle Kingswood Global (CKG). Najeeb recruits for in-house lawyers at various levels across a number of industries, including energy & utilities, retail, education, financial services, and construction.  

Najeeb’s focus is to form long term relationships with both clients and candidates. He takes the time to truly understand what his clients do, their culture and what makes them stand out as a business. He is then able to pass this knowledge and insight to suitable candidates. Najeeb will also sit down with each candidate to understand their unique skills, experience and personality.

Najeeb previously worked as a Recruitment Consultant at Charterhouse Partnership and Dolman Worldwide Legal Search & Recruitment where he was able to successfully place candidates across a number of top-tier, mid-tier and boutique firms, as well as in in-house roles. 

Prior to legal recruitment Najeeb was a Publishing Manager at LexisNexis, which is the largest and oldest legal publishing company in the world. Najeeb was responsible for managing Halsbury’s Laws of Australia, Precedents, Journals and Newsletters. 

Najeeb has a LLM from the University of New South Wales. Having practiced law for several years, he understands the unique job requirements for lawyers.

general.description:
I founded Beacon Legal and am a current Director. I have numerous years of experience within the legal industry having worked at top US, UK and Australian law firms. I qualified and practiced as a Finance Lawyer at a Top Tier London firm and also worked as Legal Counsel at a FTSE 100 Bank. 

I am a Senior Recruitment Manager and have managed multiple P&Ls and large successful teams, including a specialist legal recruitment division which I led to achieve record results in 2017.

Beacon Legal combines legal experience with senior level recruitment experience which gives us a unique ability to provide our candidates and clients with a bespoke, credible and reliable service.

Find out more at www.beacon-legal.com.au and please get in touch with any queries.

Alex.Gotch@beacon-legal.com.au
Australia: 02 9030 0335
UK: 0203 797 6330

jobs.description:
Beacon Legal is a recruitment and career consultancy for the legal industry. We combine legal qualifications and experience with recruitment management to provide expert services to candidates and clients. We place lawyers at all levels on a permanent, interim and temporary basis.

We have offices in Sydney and London and provide services in key international markets: Australia; Asia; UK; New York; Dubai and the Cayman Islands.

In my role as Director I am responsible for the operations of the business as well as playing an active role in legal recruitment.

I managed the Legal Division for Robert Walters, covering the Australian market. My team operated within Private Practice from Associate to Partner level and In-house from Junior Legal Counsel to General Counsel level.

Achievements I am proud of:

* In 2017, I led the Legal Division to achieve record revenue performance. Our team was the second most profitable team in Australia and New Zealand out of over 50 other teams and a top performing team globally amongst hundreds of teams.
* Mentoring my reporting staff to achieve success and promotions, notably two of them qualifying for the global incentive trip and being ranked number 1 and 2 for permanent recruitment across Australia and New Zealand.
* Personally, I was the top individual billing Manager in 2017 whilst also managing a team of 10. I qualified for the global incentive trip as a result of this performance.

Berwin Leighton Paisner (BLP) is an international, multi-service law firm with 14 offices
      across 10 countries. BLP is regarded as a 'Silver Circle' law firm and one of the most
      prestigious in the UK and globally. BLP merged with US firm Bryan Cave LLP in 2018
      
      and is now known as Bryan Cave Leighton Paisner.

Barclays is a UK and US listed Financial Services company which operates in over 40
      countries and employs circa 120,000 staff. I was part of the Legal Team based at the
      
      Head Office in London.

general.headline: National Talent Manager at Maurice Blackburn Lawyers
general.description:
One thing that highly successful organisations have in common is the way they work together with their people, to bring about positive outcomes.  

My professional HR career started back in 2004, when fresh out of university with my Bachelor of Arts majoring in HR and Psychology, I joined one of the country’s largest entertainment companies.  At Strike Entertainment, I worked in corporate sales and event management.

International professional opportunities called me in 2006, and after touring Europe for a number of months, I assumed the position of Communications Event Coordinator with ABN Amro in London.  From here, I took on an event coordination role with Goldman Sachs and from there, I moved back to ABN Amro to fill the position of EA/Junior Business Manager.  

In September 2007, upon returning to Australia, I accepted the position of HR Administrator at Deacons (known as Norton Rose).  

From here, my HR career took me to another legal firm (known as King & Wood Mallesons) where I worked in a predominantly Organisational and Capability Development role (O&CD).  It was a role I stayed in until May 2010, when I joined the ranks of national firm, Maurice Blackburn Lawyers.  I started out as a Human Resources Consultant, and was promoted twice until I assumed the role of Victorian Human Resource Manager. 

In 2013, I moved into a small HR consulting business, fibreHR, who's main aim is to support small to medium size businesses with all things HR. 

In January 2016, I made a lifestyle change and moved to Darwin and commenced my role as HR Manager for NT, WA and SA for the national firm, Maurice Blackburn. 

In August 2018, I relocated to the sunny location of the Gold Coast and commenced in a newly created position within Maurice Blackburn, being the National Talent Manager. My role is to lead and develop the Talent function to deliver attraction and recruitment solutions to support the development of people capability across the firm nationally.

jobs.description:
fibreHR is a Melbourne-based full service HR firm, providing human resource assistance to the small to medium enterprise sector.

At fibreHR, we provide HR advice when it comes to:

•	HR Audit/healthcheck
•	Induction/on boarding
•	Contracts and policies
•	Processes and Systems
•	Performance Management
•	Training
•	Terminations
•	Pay, benefits and award interpretations
•	Recruitment (strategy and placements)

fibreHR has had the honour of working with some of this country’s most loved household names, including kikki. K, Bevilles, Carman’s Fine Foods and PetStock.  

As the HR Business Partner at fibreHR, my key duties include:  

•	Providing HR consultation and advice to clients; and
•	Working with the Director to help achieve critical objectives and KPI’s.

April 2012 – February 2013 (Victorian Human Resources Manager)
November 2011 – April 2012 (Senior HR Consultant – Acting HR Manager)
May 2010 – November 2011 (Human Resources Consultant)

Founded in 1919, Maurice Blackburn Lawyers are compensation lawyers who help clients when it comes to workers compensation, medical negligence, asbestos exposure and car accidents.  

My role at the firm was multi-faceted and I reported to the General Manager of HR and the National HR Manager.  During my time at Maurice Blackburn, I was promoted twice and concluded my tenure managing a team of four direct reports.  The role not only enabled me to build on my existing capabilities, but also broadened my knowledge and expertise in generalist HR Operations and staff management.

My key duties across the roles included:

• Team management
o	Responsible for the management of VIC HR team.
o	Providing coaching and feedback on all aspects of HR management.
• Recruitment / On boarding / Induction
o	Arranging and coordinating recruitment, selection and engagement of staff.
o	Overseeing teams management of Seasonal Clerk and Trainee Lawyers  (Graduate) recruitment, rotations and feedback processes.
• Performance / Remuneration / Reward
o	Assisting in the design, development and training of staff in relation to the firm’s performance appraisal processes.
o	Ensuring any performance management issues are dealt with in a timely manner and managed and documented appropriately.
o	Providing advice to Principals/Managers on salary bands, peer bands, and equity of remuneration nationally.
o	Managing staff employment conditions as per the firm’s EBA.
• Learning and Development
o	Consulting, developing and delivering training and development programs as appropriate.
• Workforce Planning / Retention
o                Analysing and reporting on headcount and other people-related issues.
o	Ensuring programs and processes were implemented and regularly reviewed to support retention of staff.

Mallesons Stephen Jaques were an international law firm that as a result of merging with King & Wood, are now known as King & Wood Mallesons, consisting of 1800 lawyers.  It is the only law firm today that can practice Australian law, in addition to Chinese, Hong Kong and English Law.  The firm has offices throughout Australia, and also in Hong Kong and London.

While I was at Mallesons, I reported to the OCD Manager.  This role has enabled me to build on my existing capabilities in resourcing, whilst at the same time broadening my knowledge and experience in the O&CD area.

In the position Capability Development O&CD/Resourcing Coordinator, my key responsibilities included:

• O&CD
o	Managing and coordinating all internal and external training programs for legal staff.
o	As part of Project team, assisted in the design, development and implementation of Mallesons’ International Graduate Program (IGP) - an international education and rotation based program - launched Feb 2010.
o	Coordinating one of the two main education programs within IGP National Program.
o	Assisting in the design and implementation of change management processes transferring the Melbourne Centre from Articles to Practical Legal Training for law graduates.
o	Assisting in managing graduate and external training budget.
o	Designing, developing and coordinating 3 x seasonal clerk programs, yearly.
o	Modernising and coordinating fortnightly new starter induction program.
o	Building and maintaining relationships with internal and external clients.
o	General administration.
• Resourcing
o	Assisting Graduate Resourcing Consultant with Melbourne Seasonal Clerk & Graduate recruitment.
o	Assisting in the development and coordination of "Insight Program" for high potential 3rd year University students.
o	Attending Career Fairs, Careers Information Evenings, Insight evenings and University events promoting Mallesons as an employer of choice in Graduate market.
o	General administration.

Known today as Norton Rose, this legal firm is one of the country’s largest international legal firms with over 600 lawyers nationwide.

In this position, I reported to the Human Resources Manager. Whilst the role was initially HR Administrator duties, due to my initiative and work ethic, my Manager quickly recognised my capability and I was provided with additional responsibilities and opportunities.  I was able to contribute to the wider HR team by participating in and managing a number of projects further cementing my knowledge and career in HR.

In my role as Human Resources Administrator, my key responsibilities included:
•	Coordinating and participating in recruitment processes including writing job advertisements, reviewing applications and interviewing
•	Preparing Letters of Offer and associated new starter packs and processed all new starter paperwork including preparation of letters for Internal Transfers, Maternity / Leave of Absence
•	Working with the National HR Project Manager, created and coordinated a new induction program for the Firm nationally
•	Coordinating new employee induction program on a fortnightly basis facilitating the initial introduction and first-aid sessions
•	Providing back up support to HRMS team by updating personal information and creating reports from HRMS system - Dynamics
•	Coordinating resignation process 
•	Assisting the Graduate Advisor with Seasonal and Articled Clerk Induction Program and participated in reviewing Resumes and arranging Graduate functions
•	Coordinating the annual Performance Planning & Review and Incentive processes for National Office
•	Managing Partners & Lawyers Practising Certificate & Law Institute of Victoria Membership Annual Renewal process
•	Arranging all staff Years of Service & Recognition Awards and ordered flowers and hampers for births, special events
•	General administration including but not limited to managing incoming mail, payroll payslip distribution, filing

ABN AMRO Bank N.V is one of the world’s largest banking organisations, providing banking solutions to private, retail and commercial clients.

In this role, I managed two Senior Managers of Services Europe and gained extensive experience and knowledge of the Company’s financial businesses and clients.  The role was fast paced and required the management of multiple projects simultaneously and excellent prioritising capability.

As Executive Assistant/Junior Business Manager, my key duties in this role included:

•	Undertaking all Executive Assistant tasks including, but not limited to, managing calendars, incoming faxes/mail, telephone monitoring, booking business travel (flights, accommodation and transport) for Managers and team
•	Creating presentations for the Finance, HR and Senior Management teams of Services Europe
•	Pro-actively ensuring Managers had appropriate documents for meetings/conferences
•	Processing expense claim forms and tracking payments
•	Arranging internal and external meetings including meeting room bookings, lunches, equipment
•	Coordinating collection of HR/People data from 13 country Heads of Services

Goldman Sachs is one of the world’s leading financial firms, providing investment banking, investment and securities management to clients including high-net worth individuals, corporations, government organisations and financial institutions.  The company was founded in 1869 and has its headquarters in New York, USA.

During my time at Goldman Sachs, I gained experience and knowledge in Fixed Income “pre” and “post” deal and non-deals working for senior management teams.  I also assisted in building Goldman Sachs’ global reputation by delivering an efficient road show presentation.

My key responsibilities in this position included:

•	Organising and managing major fixed income road shows, presentations, seminars, conferences and hospitality events globally
•	Sourcing and booking suitable venues for breakfast/ lunch presentations and dinner reservations
•	Organising flights and rail schedules, chauffeur cars and hotels for all members travelling on road shows
•	Formatting presentation slides and preparing information packs/materials
•	Managing attendee lists and liaising with attendees
•	Budgeting and tracking spending of road shows

ABN AMRO Bank N.V is one of the world’s largest banking organisations, providing banking solutions to private, retail and commercial clients.

In this position, I gained extensive experience and knowledge of the Company’s European region, coordinating logistics for workshops involving 400 members of staff (clients).

My key responsibilities in this role included:

•	Coordinating the ‘Strategy to Action’ workshop designed to translate the strategic direction of the Bank into individual actions and Leadership Team Conference: a 2 day conference designed to bring together new European leadership teams to create a common agenda
•	Sourcing venues, managing invitee lists and organising event requirements for 25 workshops
•	Attending and facilitating events ensuring all materials and requirements were met
•	Booking business travel, flights and accommodation for team members
•	Processing and monitoring invoices received, ensuring liaison with finance department
•	Restructuring content, adjusting workshop schedules to meet clients objectives often with little notice
•	Collating and preparing data from the workshops for senior management analysis
•	Providing input into management recommendations on clients behalf
•	Attending and actively participating in Senior Manager’s meetings to develop communication plans and events for clients across the Europe region

Founded in 2002, Strike Entertainment owns and operates tenpin bowling, karaoke and laser skirmish establishments across the country.

In my roles with Strike, my key responsibilities included:

•	Managing a team of four function coordinators
•	Training function coordinators and hosts on a national level as business activities expanded and new venues were opened
•	Liaising with corporate clients to arrange events to suit their specific needs
•	Creating and actively marketing corporate sales packages to meet business objectives 
•	Creating event schedules for venue managers, head chefs and financial controller for 5 national venues
•	Monitoring weekly/monthly/quarterly figures and reported forecast –v- actual to General Manager
•	Managing clients event from administration confirmation letters to financial transaction and post event communication/feedback
•	Maintaining corporate client database
•	Developing an extensive network of corporate clients: Ernst & Young, Deliotte, Macquarie Bank, Sensis & JBWere
