general.headline: HR Manager at Maurice Blackburn Lawyers
general.description:
I enjoy working with like-minded people who are down to earth, motivated and work together in a collaborative environment to achieve business goals by highlighting individual strengths.

I have a wide range of skills and am adaptable working in any situation, with any style of person.  I enjoy success through seeing the right person, placed in the right team, achieve the best they can and work along-side them to coach, engage and motivate.

As a true HR generalist, I draw upon my strong relationship building, corporate HR, project leading, performance and talent coaching expertise to provide a motivated and recognised workforce and guide leaders through the minefield of people management.

With over 12 years experience in Human Resources with a global company in Business Process Outsourcing, my specialties lie in the following areas:

- Employee Relations
- Award & Policy interpretation
- Talent Management
- Employee Engagement
- Policy development
- WHS
- Succession planning
- Corporate Social Responsibility
- External payroll coordination

jobs.description:
My role is to partner with managers to provide effective strategies and advice
      regarding employment related and day-to-day workplace issues, supporting all staff in
      performance management, conflict resolution, entitlement interpretation and providing
      
      guidance on company EBA, HR policies & compliance with Law9000.

Initially involved in setting up all aspects of the HR function in a greenfield site, including managing bulk recruitment and change during rapid period of growth.

My role at Xchanging grew from managing recruitment, corporate company inductions, performance management, managing WHS & claims, policy creation and coaching; and evolved to a more business partnering approach, including change management, employee engagement, remuneration and benefits review and talent management.

I was utilised as a floating secretary which exposed me to a variety of working styles for Partners within the firm on a rotating basis.

My role involved letter and report writing, diary management, minute taking and general administration duties.

My role included preparing letters and general correspondence, report writing, diary management and attendance at ad-hoc events for clients.

This role also included exposure to Accounts Payable, which saw me producing invoices, following up late payment and management of spreadsheets.

Elite Customer Solutions, a subsidiary for BP Australia, was my first foray into Human Resources.

This role exposed me to developing contracts, initial induction, in-house payroll coordination and general Human Resource administration duties.

My role involved diary management, liaising with clients to ascertain suitability to Workcover claims, file management, letter writing and assistance in brief preparation for Solicitors.  

My strong and trusted relationships with the Partners and Article Clerks I worked closely with, allowed me to develop my organisational skills and work seamlessly in introducing new clients to potential Workcover claims.

jobs.companyName: PwC Hong Kong and Mainland China
jobs.description:
-Managed the end to end process for senior level recruitment (Director and Partner) across all lines of service across China and Hong Kong. Engaged and partnered with the hiring Partners/managers to understand their hiring requirements, complete the initial briefing meetings setting realistic expectations and education on the hiring process.
- Work closely with LoS HRBPs providing timely and clear updates on recruitment process, approvals and integrating into their wider TA strategy.
-Recruited and managed a Sourcing Specialist to work with me to proactively generate candidate pipelines through a range of sourcing channels.
-Developed innovative recruitment strategies and managed the end to end hiring activities of assigned requisitions, delivering an efficient and effective service to all involved in the hiring process.
-Coached and guided hiring managers on human resources related policies, processes and interview skills, including direct sourcing/head hunting.

Achievements
-Drafted and implemented the PwC China Hong Kong Recruitment Agency Engagement Protocol. Initially reducing the number of recruitment partners from 150+ to 40 across all offices and establishing a firm wide process to engage agencies. This includes guidelines around timeframes when an agency can be engaged, drafting of new agency terms and setting up an approval process in order for senior management to be across agency usage and costs.
-Recruiting and managing a Sourcer/Researcher to assist in the search for senior level candidates in the market. This is a new direction for the firm that has historically relied heavily on the use of agencies to fill senior roles.
-Helped develop a program to assist secondee candidates from China with English interviews to give them a better chance of securing an opportunity in an overseas PwC office.
-Co-Chair and founder of the PwC HK GLEE (Gay and Lesbian and Everybody Else) group to promote a more inclusive and safe workplace within the firm.

-Engaged and partnered with the hiring manager/business unit leader to understand hiring requirements, complete the talent request briefing/Intake sessions setting realistic expectations and education on the end to end hiring process at eBay/PayPal
-Managed a Talent Acquisition Sourcer.
-Developed innovative recruitment strategies and managed the end to end hiring activities of assigned requisitions, delivering an efficient and effective service to all involved in the hiring process.
-Coached and guided hiring managers on Talent Acquisition related policies, processes and interview skills.
-Monitored and ensured 100% compliance of hiring process activities and resolve any discrepancies that arose prior to completion of the hiring process.
-Ensured all coordination activity was consistent and compliant with policies as appropriate and all agreed activities are completed in an accurate and timely manner eg: ATS updates, job postings, compliance, interview scheduling, assessments, reporting and any other activities relating to the hiring process
-Proactively generated candidate pipeline through a range of sourcing channels for all open requisitions utilising the most effective and cost efficient sourcing methods available
-Developed and maintained professional relationships with external recruiters
-Conducted thorough pre-screening activities in line with eBay/PayPal job requirements, presented shortlists and recommendations of the most suitable candidates for consideration for assigned requisitions.
-Prepared, presented, and negotiated job offers in a timely and efficient manner in accordance with eBay/PayPal compensation and benefits guidelines.
-Facilitated Assessment Centres for various bulk recruitment projects
-Represented the Talent Acquisition team in relationships and communication with the Human Resource Business Partner’s (HRBP’s), MyHR, Centres of Expertise (COE’s), business leaders and with other Global Talent Acquisition (GTA) team members.

-Manage the entire recruitment process for all legal and shared services positions across the firm sourcing internal and external candidates using local and global sources, SEEK, Taleo, Employee Referral Program, LinkedIn and agencies.
-Devise the appropriate recruitment strategy and plan for all roles.
-Engage with the hiring manager to educate on the recruitment process and strategy and agree an action plan
-Recruit all levels of legal employees to Senior Associate/Special Counsel level
-Recruit all roles across all shared services departments (Finance, Operations, Business Development, Human Resources, Information Technology)
-Interview first round Summer Clerk candidates with Partners (2010 – 2013)
-Manage the Summer Clerk selection process in the absence of the Graduate Recruiter (2013)
-Manage and assist recruitment related projects including the employee referral program, the upgrade of Taleo to the latest version, the introduction of an automated on-boarding system and the introduction of LinkedIn Recruiter to the firm
-Manage all recruitment agency relationships, negotiating rates and engaging search firms for specific senior or specialist roles
-Manage the relationship with Pinpoint HRM who manage the back end of Taleo for the firm including fee negotiations
-Monitor all metrics in relation to recruitment including agency spend, cost per hire and time to hire.
-Proactively contacting potential talent in the market through tools such as LinkedIn Recruiter

-Actively headhunted candidates and built up a database of future placements and prospects
-Consulted to clients on the market, best recruitment strategies and ways to attract and retain quality staff
-Prepared advertisements for positions for the in the internet
-Marketed 8 top candidates to Chartered firms on a weekly basis.
-Visited at least 5 clients on a weekly basis
-Participated in specialist industry functions such as the Institute of Chartered Accountants in Australia

-Managed the entire recruitment process for the Assurance business, sourcing internal and external candidates from Accountant to Executive Director to meet the firms resourcing requirements using local and global sources, SEEK, Taleo, Global Employee Referral Plan (GERP), agencies and other sourcing strategies.
-Worked with the business to predict and plan for the resourcing requirements for each business cycle and year.
-Instigated frequent, regular formal and informal communication with key stakeholders (Partners, Executive Directors, Senior Managers, Managers, agencies, candidates and peers) about assignment progress so that assignments were kept on track and expectations were managed accordingly.
-Prepared reports on recruitment costs and numbers of hires for weekly meetings
-Provided quality control and coaching with the business using behavioural selection and interviewing techniques to comply with state and federal employment legislation and quality outcomes.
-Regularly reported on changes in the market, competitor information, flow of candidates and remuneration trends to keep internal stakeholders and the wider recruitment team aware.
-Participated in the testing and roll out of the new Taleo Recruitment system.
-Assisted in organising and participated in the internal Expat functions.
-Lead the Induction process from the People perspective for new recruits.

Achievements
-Increased proportion of hires through direct recruitment, reducing agency spend and increasing effective engagement with the external talent pool
-Increased the quality of hires throughout the assurance business
-Built business credibility and trust with internal key stakeholders by understanding and responding to their needs, employing effective interpersonal skills and providing a high quality recruitment service to them
-Built strong relationships with selected recruitment agencies to ensure high calibre candidates and to position Ernst & Young as a “first choice” client

jobs.jobTitle: Global Change Leader - HR Transformation Project
jobs.description:
PPG is a multinational paint, coatings and specialty materials organisation employing more than 46,000 employees and operating 156 manufacturing facilities globally.  Headquartered in the US, PPG is ranked 190 on the fortune 500 with shares traded on the NYSE. PPG is a complex matrixed organisation. 

PPG embarked upon a large scale global transformation of the HR function in 2017.  This transformation involves re-engineering the HR organisation with a new operating model, new global processes and best in class enabling technology. jobs.description:
Viva Energy is a Royal Dutch Shell branded licensee owned by Vitol since August 2014. Vitol is the world’s largest privately owned energy trader. Viva Energy is one of Australia’s largest fuels retailer based on market share and consists of approximately 1,100 Shell Branded sites nationally. 
Leading a team of 7 reports, reporting to the GM of Retail and providing commercial support to the Viva Energy Directors, role accountabilities included: Development of the medium to long term Network strategy for all Shell branded Retail sites, primarily Network expansion (assessment, construction, site design and standards), performance, investment and property divestment programs and gain Director endorsement for business cases underpinning required strategy and capital expenditure, Building a viable property pipeline for future site opportunities, Management of the Coles Express Property relationship and Commercial assessment of branding for retail opportunities. 

Key Achievements: Expanded Retail footprint by 40 stores in 3 years and identified 250 potential property opportunities for growth, led development of growth strategy which underpinned the performance of multiple business units, negotiated successful commercial outcomes with Coles Express, implemented business structural change resulting in effective use of resourcing, collaborative working and wider business KPI alignment, significantly improved team engagement (top 5% of business management engagement) and team performance achievement and drove transformation change improving the operation of the capital works program, redesigning and effective capital approval process for Director approval.

general.headline: Regional Manager at Carers Queensland Inc.
general.description:
Having worked in a range of leadership roles in the community sector, I commit to working in ways that uphold and align with the organisation’s ethos and fulfil the values of the organisation while supporting people with disabilities, their families and supporters to participate in communities of their choosing, have meaningful roles and have their human rights upheld. My resume details many of my professional roles which have focussed on reaching out to people in need; speaking out for fairness and justice; and writing articles and conference papers that challenge people with disabilities, service providers, families and other supporters to plan, collaborate and deliver services that reflect and uphold human rights principles. 

My professional ethos is that people holding a variety of belief systems and ‘shared values’ of compassion, respect, justice, can work together to lead change within the disability sector, through learning and person-centred practice. I am an authentic person who values input from others. I have courageous conversations with colleagues and have relationships with many leaders in the disability sector in Queensland. I used these communication skills as Chief Executive Officer of QDN. In that role, I worked with people with disabilities who were articulate and passionate about their rights and wants as well as people with disabilities who were more reserved and still exploring ideas of choice, control and how these are balanced when working with support workers and disability service providers. In this work, I used focussed conversations, circle practice and co-design to support people with disabilities to develop a plan for what their life could look like when scaffolded by respectful and responsive supports.

general.headline: CEO Multicap
general.description: Ms Joanne Jessop has been the Chief Executive Officer of Multicap since 2006. She brings to her role many years senior management experience within the healthcare services industry, having worked in New Zealand, England and various Australian States and Territories before settling in Brisbane. She was appointed in 2013 as one of three inaugural members of the Queensland Independent Remuneration Tribunal, with the task of redesigning the pay and allowances for Members of the Queensland Legislative Assembly, and in 2014 was also appointed as a member of the Brisbane City Council Parking Taskforce. In 2014 Jo was a honoured to be a finalist in the Queenland Telstra Business Women of the Year Awards and was also a member of the affirmative team for the 2014 AIM International Women's Day Debate. She was previously a finalist in the 2009 Australian Institute of Management Excellence Awards Not for Profit Category and the 2007 Professional Manager Category and is passionate about providing improved opportunities for vulnerable people including those living with disabilities. She is a past Director of Checkup Australia, an organisation promoting healthier communities through collaboration in primary health care, and a current Director of Brisbane South Primary Health Network and a Director of Inala Primary Care, an innovative GP practice in Brisbane.

general.headline: Philanthropist; Rotarian; Author; Bequests; Marketing/Fundraising; Community/Disability Sector; Public Speaker; AirBnB
general.description:
It has been an absolute privilege, and very humbling, working in the community sector in Australia, United Kingdom, Brunei and Italy for approx 30 years.  

I continue to be excited by finding innovative ways to enhance people's  lives through story-telling, philanthropy, stewardship and, most of all, my passion to want to make a difference through serving others.    
 
My current role as Bequest and Major Gift Officer at Anglicare Southern Queensland enables me to bring all my life-learned skills together to grow our caring and giving community.

My passions include: author; presenter; professional speaker; life lessons leader; AirBnB Host; Rotarian and an artist. 

As an Author, I have loved writing and publishing two books in the Universal Life Lessons' series:

Universal Life Lessons:  My Brilliant Blue Bohemian Butterfly - (published August 2015)  - which tells the story of my youngest daughter's remarkable and courageous journey to live a full and happy life.  It gives hope to others that, no matter what their circumstances, they can live a good life if they apply the universal life lessons.

Universal Life Lessons:  Gift of Your Greatness - (published September 2016) - shares people's stories that give hope that through adversity comes strength and stamina and the ability to achieve great things.  Chapters include information regarding the Seventeen Sustainable Development Goals so that we can contribute to the UN's 2030 agenda for world peace and harmony; and to protect the planet.  The book is dedicated to Martha Farrell who was killed by the Taliban in May 2015 and a percentage of the proceeds goes to the Martha Farrell Foundation to continue her work in gender equality.

www.universallifelessons.com

jobs.description:
Susan is a life lessons leader and professional speaker promoting how through
      Universal Life Lessons' your life can be enhanced.
      

    Susan is also able to provide individual information, advice and guidance sessions or
      deliver workshops.
      

    She is the author of 'Universal Life Lessons from My Brilliant Blue Bohemian Butterfly'
      and "Universal Life Lessons - Gift of Your Greatness'.
      

    
      www.universallifelessons.com

jobs.location: Webber House, 439 Ann Street, Brisbane  Qld  4000
jobs.description:
In my amazing role as Bequest and Major Gift Officer at Anglicare Southern Queensland I enjoy connecting with our generous and caring donors.  Through building stewardship it has enabled more opportunities to 'grow our giving community'.  It is also a way to enhance peoples lives from foster children; people with disabilities; people at risk of homelessness and community and residential aged care.

I love also visiting donors in regions from far north as Bundaberg; out west to Birdsville and as far south as Coolangatta.

It is an honor being in this unique role where leaving a Major Gift now or leaving a Gift in Your Will can improve the lives of so many people in Southern Queensland to have better lives.

www.asq.org.au

Working alongside clients seeking employment opportunities under the Jobs Australia and Disability Employment Services framework.  I really enjoyed identifying the client's skillset and whether they required training, if they were job ready matching them with a suitable employer.  I also enjoyed identifying suitable employers and building trust and relationships with them to enable future placements.

My role as Manager at the New Farm Neighbourhood Centre gave me insights and lessons that have stood me in good stead ever since.  It was a very  challenging position and my 2020 vision was a little early for the organisation to step into the full level of community engaqement.  Now, I'm pleased to say that it has under the auspice of Communify.

I was appointed as the Consultant to establish Jacaranda Housing where several
      housing co-ops in South East Queensland amalgamated.  The amalgamation focused
      on the rights of tenants and ensuring the fundamental values of each of the
      
      associations remained steadfast in the new company.

In this partnership we focused on organising customised tours to Le Marche, Italy;
      building business links between Australia and Italy (through the Italian Chamber of
      Commerce (Qld) by promoting local produce of the area through tourism and authentic
      
      experiences.

I provided information, advice and guidance sessions to students choosing training that
      would give them the best employment outcome.  Sessions were held prior to the
      training; halfway through the training and at the end of the course to assist the student
      
      to find employment.

I enjoyed the role of New Deal Manager of the Prince's Trust to enable clients who were
      long term unemployed to discuss voluntary placement with not-for-profit organisations
      in Sussex.  I was responsible for assessing clients during their placement.  After their
      
      placement I assist clients with securing employment.

My role as Volunteer Co-ordinator, Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) People's Festival, was very exciting and, also, challenging.  At the time that the Heads of Government were due to meet in Brisbane, only a short time before the Twin Towers had been attacked.  It was a game-changer.  Although the Heads of Government meeting was postponed to early the following year where it was held in the Sunshine Coast, the Premier at the time, Peter Beattie announced that the CHOGM People's Festival would proceed.  It meant there was a great deal of confusion.  Therefore the need for calm, good organisational skills and a band of capable and caring volunteers, along with wonderful performers and artists, meant the CHOGM People's Festival was a huge success.  Thank goodness for our volunteers and for the staff and performers who excelled!!

Prior to being a Co-Founder of Career Employment Australia, I was Manager of Paddington SkillShare where a group of like-minded skillshare associations in South East Queensland merged when it became an open market due to funding cuts by the Howard Government.  CEA has grown and now has multiple-branches throughout Australia offering quality training and employment opportunities with the same value base of ensuring a quality, person-centred, strengths-based service.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer at Lifeline Australia
general.description:
Bob is an accomplished and dedicated Chief Executive with a background in the Not-For-Profit service industry sector built over 25+ years in Australia. Bob leads by example and inspires and engages everyone with whom he comes into contact to work for the betterment of their clients and their community. Highly regarded for working alongside, educating and influencing executive teams and boards ensuring strategic thinking and planning is aligned to the organization and changes in the community. 

Bob demonstrates his ability and resiliency when translating business realities into a clear business strategy; then collaborates with executive teams to integrate effort across all functions to ensure high performance outcomes. Bob holds people accountable to high standards, infuses and models organization’s values in which he has built his career and makes sure every day that the organizational mission, clients and community are paramount.


KEY STRENGHTS

An externally community focused leader, who adds long-term sustainable value.
A strategic approach to organizational direction, combined with an action orientated problem solving approach to get things done through people and operations.
A leader with the ability to unite & motivate teams of people to achieve the goals. 
Calm & considered demeanor that inspires confidence.
A strong communicator with internal and external stakeholders, staff at all levels, Boards, using highly developed listening and facilitation skills.
Service Industry performance driven – align the strategy, organization and goals, measure the performance, and deliver solid service-centric outcomes.

jobs.description:

Accountable for the strategic direction and operations of 135 lifeline stores throughout QLD, including logistics and warehousing to support this. Financially accountable for a Budget $190M. people leadership of 2800 staff, 6800 volunteers.

general.headline: Construction Disputes Lawyer at McCullough Robertson | Legal Counsel (Secondee) at Telstra | Co-Chair, Events, NAWIC QLD
general.description:
Madelaine is a Lawyer in the Construction team at McCullough Robertson, specialising in construction and infrastructure litigation, dispute avoidance and resolution.  Madelaine is currently on secondment at Telstra, providing support to internal Networks and Property stakeholders.

With Australian industry knowledge and experience advising and acting for clients involved in complex contractual and security for payment disputes and adjudications, Madelaine’s Australian experience includes acting for and advising leading Australian construction companies in a range of matters, including contract management and administration, dispute resolution and the preparation of adjudication applications and responses in the range of $20 - 30 million.

While working in the United Kingdom for Pinsent Masons in Construction Advisory and Disputes, Madelaine gained valuable experience assisting in proceedings before the Scottish Court of Session and the English Technology and Construction Courts. Madelaine also worked on complex proceedings before the High Court of Justice in Northern Ireland, including preparation of key witness and expert evidence.

Madelaine is Co-Chair of the Events Committee for the National Association of Women in Construction, Queensland Branch.

jobs.description:
Advising and acting for clients involved in complex contractual and security for payment disputes and adjudications, extensive contract management and administration. Preparation of adjudication responses for large national principals. Advising and acting for clients in Supreme and District Court of Queensland proceedings, including briefing counsel and expert witnesses.

Key highlight:
• Proceedings brought in Supreme Court of Queensland regarding contractual interpretation issue between North Queensland sugar crushing company and cane transporter.
• Key responsibilities included preparation of key witness affidavits, including consideration of key technical evidence, preparing key court documents, liaising with counsel.

jobs.companyName: NAWIC QLD - National Association of Women in Construction (QLD)
jobs.description:
NAWIC is an Australian Not-For-Profit organisation formed in 1995 whose mission is to champion and empower women in the construction and related industries to reach their full potential. NAWIC provides a forum for its members to meet and exchange information, ideas and solutions.

The association offers members an opportunity to expand personal and business networks, maintain awareness of industry developments, improve skills and knowledge, and make a contribution to other women in the construction industry.

jobs.jobTitle: Lawyer (Qualified in Australia (Queensland)), Construction Advisory Disputes
jobs.description:
Based in Scotland, working on matters throughout the UK and Middle East, this role required great flexibility and diligence in ensuring the subtle differences between Scots Law, Northern Irish Law, and English and Welsh Law  were identified and applied as required.  Key focus on dispute avoidance and management, adjudication and litigation.  Particular exposure to Scottish Court of Session disputes, including drafting pleadings, witness statements, and managing day-to-day conduct of proceedings in line with court procedure.

Key highlight:
• Proceedings brought in the High Court of Justice in Northern Ireland regarding contractual interpretation issue between former and current owner of a wastewater treatment facility in Belfast.
• Key responsibilities include managing disclosure of over 220,000 documents, including searching and coding plaintiff‘s online database; delegating tasks to junior staff; liaising with client team to draft witness statements; travelling to Belfast to take and develop key technical witness statement; liaising with junior and Queen‘s Counsel; preparing court pleadings and day-to-day correspondence.

Focus on dispute avoidance, Queensland adjudications and enforcement proceedings, including drafting letters of advice, submissions, instructing experts and drafting statements within strict legislative time frames.

Key highlight:
• With five weeks notice and a team of two, pulled together a $23million adjudication application. 
 Difficulties with claim included high volume of technical and design variations; significant programming and delay issues; and several key witnesses working shifts in Malaysia, giving rise to availability and time zone issues.
• Key responsibilities included project management on preparation and submission of claim; closely liaising with client; taking and working up four key witness statements covering technical, factual and quantum aspects of claim.

general.headline: Managing Partner at McCullough Robertson
general.description:
I am a commercial and resources lawyer and have worked closely with the Australian mining and resources industry for the past 18 years.  I have extensive expertise in the structuring and establishment of major resource projects and regularly advise on infrastructure sharing arrangements, joint ventures and financing arrangements within the industry.

I am experienced in negotiating multiparty arrangements for complex or novel aspects of resource projects.  I am also regularly involved in sales and acquisitions of significant assets for a range of clients.  These include listed and large private companies involved in exploration and operation projects in coal, coal seam gas (CSG), conventional oil and gas, iron ore, and minerals including uranium and base metals.

I have also helped a variety of clients and industry bodies in the implementation of risk management strategies to assist with the introduction of the Personal Property and Securities Act (PPSA).  As part of this, I have presented to various interest groups and clients throughout Queensland on the impacts of this new legislation and have written numerous articles including articles published in the New South Wales Law Society Journal and the Australian Construction Law Journal.

I am a founding member of the McCullough Robertson Innovation team, which in 2015 won a place on the Lexis Nexis/Janders Dean 2015 Legal Innovation Index.

general.headline: HR consulting, executive coaching and professional studies.
general.company: Professional studies in neuroscience and neuroplasticity.
general.description:
People are critical to every organisation and it is important to be able to attract, develop and retain them to achieve specific business outcomes.  My objective is to work in a dynamic and challenging leadership environment and execute HR strategic plans. I am passionate about all People aspects.  I drive increased business improvement, performance management, and engagement and retention. I am an expert at implementing change, managing key initiatives and achieving strong results.  As a HR leader, I coach and develop teams and individuals for solid outcomes. With strong influencing skills and presence, I successfully consult to executive teams and people at all levels.  I work hard to build lasting relationships based on trust, commitment and accountability.

Specialties: strategic HR execution, leadership capability and executive coaching, performance and succession planning, change management and all aspects of HR operations - implementing new HR teams and operating models, improved outcomes of brand, recruitment, engagement, retention and workforce planning.

jobs.description: HR consulting and executive coaching.

Operating at Director level, I was responsible for implementing an integrated HR strategic plan, a new national HR operating model of HR business partners and (COEs) and developing, leading and coaching the Country Managing Partners and senior leaders.  

As an integral member of the national and international leadership teams I was instrumental in creating a platform for change, accountability and results.

I also lead and developed a team of HR professionals across Australia, while collaborating with international global teams, to deliver services of high value and local relevance.

Key achievements include introducing initiatives to create: a high performance culture; leadership capability and coaching; succession planning; engagement and retention; resourcing and brand; diversity and inclusion; and business analytics, improvements and efficiencies.

As the Oceania Tax Talent leader I was responsible for developing, leading and coaching the executive leadership team for strategic and operational people initiatives. Linking the client’s strategic, business and industry outcomes I devised People plans that took an Area and cross sub service lines (SSL) and geographic approach. I had full accountability of the strategic plans of recruitment, HR operations, learning & development and all other people activities. To measure success, I regularly sought  feedback and reviewed and reported on progress and celebrated achievements and identified future improvements.

jobs.description: Responsible for the strategic and operational people initiatives nationally, I managed the HR generalist areas and provided professional advice and support on performance management, remuneration, counselling, Workplace Occupational Health & Safety, employment law, restructuring/job design and reward, recognition and retention.  Reporting to the National P&D Director, I managed the P&D Client Services team across Australia supporting all partners, lawyers, directors and professional staff of up to 1,800.  My national P&D Client Services team consulted directly to the business and included 20 team members across Australia, including: Brisbane, Melbourne, Perth and Sydney.

Managing the international offices of London, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Bangkok and San Francisco I was seconded to a start-up role to establish human resources management for the international offices.  Reporting to the National Human Resources Director, I worked closely with the overseas based partners, National Practice Group Partners and Managers, International Partner and the Operations Management team.  Established a performance review model, consolidated policies and procedures, managed recruitment and secondments, clerkship program, salary and bonus review, payroll and local benefits review, established international welcome kits, and staff and partner secondment manuals.

general.headline: National Chairman & Partner at Gadens
general.description:
I am the current National and Brisbane Chairman of Gadens and am considered one of Australia’s leading experts in property law, commercial negotiation and facilitation. I was also the Attorney General’s representative on the Queensland Law Society Council between 2014 and 2015.

My practice has focused on transport infrastructure, innovative land use and project development. I also advise on all aspects of building and construction for large-scale mixed-use developments (including advising on the transactions documents usually associated with these types of developments) and large commercial transactions. I have extensive experience in finding solutions for the integration and connectivity of residential, commercial and mixed-use developments.

I am highly experienced in preparing innovative structures for joint ventures both with public bodies and in the private sector, including the provision of urban renewal projects. I also have considerable expertise in all areas of rail transport infrastructure, including transit-oriented developments. Additionally, I advise offshore, national and local developers of residential and mixed-use precincts, retail shopping centres and luxury resorts, and lead negotiations between stakeholders and key players on multi-party transactions.

I have experience in dispute resolution processes and procedures and am often called upon by my clients to negotiate commercial outcomes rather than turning to full-scale litigation. I always adopt a collaborative team based approach with projects, often drawing together other specialists within the firm as a project leader to obtain the best outcomes for my clients

general.headline: Director l Legal Recruitment Specialist l Candidate & Client Advisor l Absolutely PASSIONATE about helping others GROW!
general.description:
I started my career in legal working in a boutique law firm and gained a bucket load of experience before joining an international top tier law firm.  I thought I had “arrived”.  I quickly realised how differently the two environments were and how much more there was to learn. 

I loved it.  I thrived.  I grew.  I learnt and learnt some more!

After almost 15 years in legal, I “accidently” fell into recruitment.  I was surprised at first.  I had no expectations. I had no prior knowledge of the ups and downs.  I didn’t even know I had it in me to care about people and their careers so much. 

I finally had the courage to establish Boutique Legal Recruitment and take a chance on myself.  I want to provide high quality, professional and personal end to end recruitment.  I want candidates and clients to have a different experience, like no other.  I want candidates to know that their career and life is important to me.  I want them to trust me. 

I am known for being able to build lasting and strong client and candidate relationships.  My core values of strong ethics and integrity are demonstrated in all that I do.  

I am absolutely passionate about helping people.  I am a strong encourager and motivator and believe that everyone can achieve whatever they set their minds to, with hard work and dedication.

jobs.description:
I provide specialist "end to end" recruitment for the legal industry for top tier, mid tier, highly regarded boutique, in-house, national and global law firms.


This includes taking detailed job briefs from clients, creating descriptive and enticing advertisements, personally liaising and screening all candidate responses, receiving confidential resumes and having the ability to establish and determine exceptional candidates, personally interviewing candidates and immediately establishing strong rapport on a personable, engaging, yet professional level, writing detailed and accurate candidate reports to describe candidate personality and potential cultural fit for the right role in the right firm, conducting in depth and thorough reference reports and checks of candidates, organising interview times and negotiating salary offers and assisting with employment contracts. 


I have also developed strong and loyal relationships with a number of clients throughout my career and liaise personally with them on a day to day basis. I provide clients with high level service based on integrity, high ethics and excellence. I am thorough, accurate, honest and extremely professional.

Hands on "end to end" legal support recruitment for all tiers in the legal industry. 
      Providing high level service in the recruitment of legal secretaries, paralegals,
      executive and personal assistants, accounts, word processing operators, practice
      
      managers, legal accounts, HR administrators and marketing assistants.

This role was my introduction to legal recruitment.  Having previously worked in a boutique general practice as Practice Manager and Paralegal to supporting a Senior Partner in an international top tier law firm, the transition into the recruitment industry was seamless.  


With my genuine passion for helping people achieve their dream role and the opportunity of working alongside high achieving and highly regarded legal consultants, I was able to grow professionally and successfully.


I was responsible for establishing and maintaining client relationships and developing strong rapport with candidates.

I handled "end to end" recruitment of legal support staff for a large legal client base.

My prior experience working in pharmacies, one of which was closely associated with providing assistance to those in a private psychiatric hospital, and at the Autism Association of Western Australia has greatly contributed to my passion for helping families in need.

I am a member of the Law Society of Western Australia and the Family Law Practitioners Association of Western Australia. During my time at University, I won awards in Family Law, Mental Health Law and the Law of Remedies.

About Butlers
At Butlers, we understand the challenges our clients face. Divorce, Family Law matters, Probate and Wills & Estate Planning can be some of the most stressful experiences a person will ever go through in their life. Our goal is to provide our clients with the highest quality service and help our clients find confidence during such uncertain times. With our combined legal experience we understand what our clients need.

general.headline: Co-founder & CEO at Canva
general.description:
Melanie recently raised one of Australia’s largest early stage investment rounds as CEO of Canva, a disruptive online platform allowing anyone to create professional quality designs, to investors in Silicon Valley and Australia. Canva has been growing rapidly since its launch in August 2013 and is now empowering millions of people across from every corner of the globe to create great designs and reach their goals, whether that's landing a job with a stylish resume, getting their business off the ground by creating great marketing materials or connecting with their community by designing great social media graphics.

Previously, Melanie founded her first company, Fusion Books, an online design system for schools to create their yearbooks. Fusion Books is now the largest yearbook publisher in Australia and recently expanded to France and New Zealand. 

Our team is growing like crazy and we're just getting started on our adventure. If you'd like to join us or just a little curious - check out our careers page: https://about.canva.com/careers/

general.headline: Director at The Ministry Of Talent, Sweaty Betty PR and Pixies Bows
general.description:
Founder and Director of one of Australia's leading PR companies, Sweaty Betty PR, which represents some of the globes leading brands across Australia, coordinating the most talked about events and creating unique activations in both a traditional & non-traditional capacity. In addition to this, Roxy also founded The Ministry Of Talent in 2012 - Australia's first management agency solely dedicated to creative talent and digital influencers.

A former contestant on the third season of Channel 9, Celebrity Apprentice, Roxy is also the author of three successful fiction novels – Strictly Confidential, The Rumour Mill and The Spotlight – taking readers on a whirlwind journey through the life of Jazzy Lou, climbing her way up through Australia’s PR industry.

 Mum to the ‘Princess of Instagram’, Pixie Curtis, she has built the hair bow brand ‘Pixies Bows’ from an idea into a global brand that is now sought after by Hollywood A-listers for their tots.

jobs.description:
Sweaty Betty PR is Australia's preeminent fashion, beauty and lifestyle PR agency. No one else can boast the commitment, contacts and coverage of the Sweaty Betty PR team. We stop at nothing to ensure we exceed your expectations, on time, every time.

We are fresh, original and modern in our approach. PR is not one size fits all. We take the time to learn who you are, what you need and who you are trying to reach. Sweaty Betty PR commit to providing the best – day in, day out, resulting in the best coverage, service and ideas for each and every client. We have redefined PR through our relentless pursuit for perfection in everything we do. The results speak for themselves.

Sweaty Betty PR is the fastest, brightest and most passionate agency in the business. With a diverse and dynamic team of publicists, plus an in house designer, writer and driver Sweaty Betty PR can deliver a range of unique and specialised services. We excel in delivering all the PR staples; press releases, brand profiles, and media coverage. But where we really shine is in the unique, the fabulous and the attention grabbing! We are famous for our super creative initiatives, delivering a series of unforgettable events, launches, social media campaigns and PR stunts for our clients.

Dominating every facet of media coverage across the country, Sweaty Betty PR will get your brand exposure in all the right places. Sweaty Betty PR has an enviable contact list of Australian media from luxury magazines, glossy monthlies, newspapers and television to various online outlets, blogs and social media. We pride ourselves on our personal relationships with editors, journalists, columnists, freelancers, stylists, publishers and bloggers. We also have close working relationships with a host of celebrities, models, sports personalities and designers – ensuring your brand is forefront in the minds of industry opinion leaders.

Representing Australia’s leading creatives, bloggers and social media influencers, The Ministry of Talent is at the forefront of talent management in the digital age. With a diverse offering of world class social media identities, The Ministry of Talent is a hotbed of exciting talent and innovative collaborations.

The Ministry of Talent is Australia’s first management agency solely dedicated to creative talent and digital influencers. Established in late 2012 by Roxy Jacenko, founder of Sweaty Betty PR, The Ministry of Talent has forged a new path in talent management to give brands endless ways to connect with consumers in ingenious, immersive ways. Since then, The Ministry of Talent has set the standard nationwide for agency representation in the creative space and blogosphere. Roxy has the experience, resources, relationships and vision to create trends and make headlines.

The Ministry of Talent represents a full spectrum of talent who cover everything from fashion, beauty, health and fitness, interiors, lifestyle, events and travel as well as social media imagery specialists, photographers, illustrators and youth specific influencers. Curating the finest innovators and trend setters in the country, The Ministry of Talent is the authority on what is hot right now.

In the digital landscape, ideas and trends move quickly. The Ministry of Talent anticipates new directions in consumer engagement, making connections and coordinating one of kind collaborations between talent and brands. From custom illustrations and artwork, sponsored blog and Instagram posts, video content,  social media image creation, in-store appearances and presentations – with The Ministry of Talent the options are limited only by your imagination.

general.headline: Forbes 30 Under 30, 2018 | 5x Startup Founder | 16 Million Combined Followers on Instagram | $1M eCommerce Sales in a Day
general.description:
⭐️ Tap [...] and hit 'FOLLOW' 👆🏼

Disclaimer: I cannot stand bio's written in third person but I also cannot be bothered re-writing this bio that was written for me for a conference, so let's do this:

“Gretta van Riel is one of Australia’s top young serial entrepreneurs. 

With 5 multi-million dollar startups under her belt, Gretta prides herself on turning audiences into brands and trends into markets. 

She loves to hack a social media algorithm with over 16 million followers on Instagram, over 5.8M impressions a month on Pinterest and 2.6M views of her content on LinkedIn in 10 days. She once grew an Instagram account from 0-48,500 followers in a day. 

Gretta founded her first startup, SkinnyMe Tea (SMT), at the age of 22 with $24 in the bank. SMT went on to be a global success going on to win the Shopify Build-A-Business competition in 2013. Five years on, SMT has now  sold over 11 million cups of tea worldwide and helped their customers lose a combined 1.5M kgs.

Gretta later went on to co-create The 5TH Watches (www.the5th.co), which achieved over $100k in revenue on it’s first day of sales, and $1M in a single day of sales. Gretta exited The 5TH in late 2017.

More recently, Gretta has shifted her focus from eComm to tech. 

Leveraging her extensive knowledge of the influencer marketing landscape as both a brand and an influencer Gretta launched her Influencer Marketing platform − Hey Influencers. 

Hey Influencers is an Influencer Relationship Management (IRM) and campaign creation platform helping to connect and cultivate relationships between brands and social media influencers.”

Like many successful companies, Finite started with an idea of how to do something better. Founded in 1998, the company was born from a desire to offer recruitment expertise and IT jobs on a specialist basis to information technology jobseekers and employers.

Business has consistently grown year-on-year since then, even in challenging economic conditions. Finite now has six national Australian offices and is an acknowledged market leader. Finite was also the launch partner for the iProfile CV tool into the Australian market.

Finite recruits permanent, executive and contract IT professionals (local and international). We find the right people for the right IT job at the right time!

Specialties
IT Permanent Recruitment, IT Contract Recruitment, IT Executive Recruitment (please visit www.finxec.com.au), Contractor Payrolling Services, we are market leaders in the Banking & Finance, Telco and Government Sectors.

Sirius Technology, the original brand of SRG was launched in January 2003 and is an agency that specialises in the contract and permanent recruitment of staff within IT across all sectors. Our consultants work in Technology recruitment niches to maximise access to job opportunities for candidates and access the very best candidates for clients. With an initial focus on servicing clients who required IT staff within the Financial Services Industry, sirius technology over the years has spread its focus and now specialise in IT across all areas of Industry and Commerce. Although we still have one of the strongest Banking and Finance Technology recruitment teams in Sydney, we also have a very strong presence across Government, Industry and Professional Service Sectors.

general.headline: Senior Associate at King & Wood Mallesons
general.description:
I am a Senior Associate in the Dispute Resolution Group in the Perth office of King & Wood Mallesons.

I have experience in a range of commercial litigation matters in the District Court of Western Australia, Supreme Court of Western Australia and in the Federal Court of Australia.  I also have experience acting for clients in international arbitrations under the ICC, SIAC and UNCITRAL Rules, and in adjudications under state security of payment legislation, including the WA CCA, and SA and NT SOPA.  

I have acted for clients in a broad range of areas including in large and complex disputes arising in the energy and resources sector, contentious corporate matters, and disputes in the building and construction industry (both on the principal and contractor side).

In 2015 I spent 4 months at Chevron Australia on secondment to their in-house finance and accounting teams, working and liaising directly with commercial managers and King & Wood Mallesons’ tax teams to assist in the preparation and submission of a detailed response to various ATO inquiries in relation to tax related matters on the Gorgon Project.

general.headline: Principal at Davies Collison Cave
general.description: Gordon is a principal of Davies Collison Cave Law, practising in the area of technology, data protection and IP. He is the author or editor of eight texts, and a former president of the Law Council of Australia. In 2017, he was awarded an Order of Australia (AM) “for significant service to the law, to professional organisations and to international affairs and legal practice in the Asia-Pacific region”.

jobs.description:
Davies Collison Cave Law is a boutique legal practice focussed on intellectual property, information technology and data protection law. 

Dr Gordon Hughes is a Principal, practising  in the area of information technology law, data protection law, electronic commerce, privacy and intellectual property rights.  

He has authored leading texts on IT contracts and privacy law, and has served on various government advisory bodies. He is also a qualified arbitrator. 

His practice focuses on the drafting and negotiation of IT and outsourcing contracts, advising on e-commerce, commercialisation, procurement and data protection issues and representing clients in IT dispute resolution. He has acted for both suppliers and customers, and for both the public and private sectors. 

Gordon has been a leader of the Australian and international legal profession, having served as president of the Law Institute of Victoria, the Law Council of Australia and Lawasia. In 2006, he was awarded a Lifetime Achievement Award at the Australian Law Awards, and in 2010 he was elected a Fellow of the Australian Academy of Law. He is an Adjunct Professor, and a part time member of the Commonwealth Administrative Appeals Tribunal. 

•University of Melbourne (Bachelor of Laws - Hons) 
•University of Melbourne (Master of Laws) 
•Monash University (PhD) 
•Partner at Blake Dawson/Ashurst 1997 - 2015
•Principal at Davies Collison Cave 2016 to date

general.headline: Partner and Board Member, Chair of Diversity and Inclusion Advisory Committee, Sparke Helmore Lawyers
general.description:
I am a senior insurance litigation lawyer with more than 20 years' experience advising insurers, underwriters, brokers, government departments, statutory authorities and large Australian corporations in relation to their general insurance risks. My particular focus is on liability claims, often complex multi-party claims involving recovery from contractors and the enforcement of indemnity provisions. I also have a large London practice acting for underwriters, brokers and claims managers who place risks in Australia out of the Lloyds Market.

I like to work collaboratively with my clients to ensure that we develop the most effective commercial resolutions. I lead strong teams of lawyers who strive for excellence, provide the highest standards of professionalism, integrity and advice. 

As a board member of Sparke Helmore I am part of the team that is responsible for the firm’s strategic direction, ensuring excellence in the firm’s governance, management and client service. I am particularly focused on diversity within the legal profession, and in ensuring that our firm has formal and informal structures to encourage, motivate and support all individuals to achieve their potential.  

I regularly share insights with clients through training on developments in insurance and liability law. I actively participate in the ANZIIF Claims Discussion Group and am a former committee member and chair of this group.

jobs.description:
Bright Sparke is an innovation hub established by Sparke Helmore Lawyers to develop
      the very best technology-based solutions and allied non-legal services for our clients.

The Board of Sparke Helmore is appointed by the partnership and is responsible for the
      overall strategy and direction of the firm. I am one of eight Board members, and am
      the chair of the firm’s Diversity and Inclusion Committee.

Sparke Helmore Lawyers is a firm with more than 700 people working from eight offices across Australia, serving the needs of the insurance, government, financial services, technology, mining, construction and property sectors. Our expertise spans insurance and workplace, corporate and commercial to construction, IP to IPOs, mining to manufacturing, and property to procurement.

As a partner, I work closely with clients to ensure they achieve their legal and commercial objectives, which often includes reducing organisational risk, claims and legal cost. I seek to bring to them technical excellence, tenacious negotiating skills and a balanced commercial approach. To assist in the management of claims, I have been involved in developing innovative quality assurance programs, including national file audits, training programs and client surveys.

In 2007 I worked with a team at Sparke Helmore to establish a women's mentoring and network programme, Six Degrees and was the inaugural Chair of this group.

For the past 14 years, I am proud to have been the chair of the Anglican Deaconess Ministries, the mission of which is to support women within the Church to achieve practical and public engagement. I am also a member of the General Synod of the Anglican Church and  am the first female appointed to the Appellate Tribunal of the Anglican Church.
I conducted a large common law practice across a range of industries and insurers.

Events management: • Identifying and assisting with the delivery and management of seminars, events and industry sponsorships; and • Identifying opportunities for partners to build their media and client relationships profiles through networking opportunities with key decision makers. 

Pitching: • Project managing and leading tender, capability statement and pricing proposal responses.

A very specific pitching and tender heavy role, the position included:  Creating and updating tender forecasting process; • Coaching partners and senior lawyers on best practices for tender responses; • Collating and updating relevant practice group track-record information; • Project managing and leading the tender process from initial analysis through to submission of response - including ensuring key milestone deadlines were met; • Developing and managing relationships with key stakeholders across all offices and practice areas relevant to tender responses; • Collaborating with practice unit and sector focus business development managers in Australia and overseas to ensure best content for responses; • Assisting client relationship partners to manage bid response teams - including other firm partners and lawyers and responding to client queries; • Working with client relationship partners and other key firm stakeholders to create the unique selling point (USP) of the response; • Working with all relevant tender response fee earners to ensure their CV experience is reflect of client needs; • Liaising with Risk, Finance and other key departments to ensure compliance between tender requirements and firm approved processes; • Gate-keeper for overall quality of document response and timely management of the response • Assisting key personnel with post-tender response presentations (‘beauty parades’) to clients; and • Assisting client relationship partners and key stakeholders with post tender debriefs.

general.headline: Partner at Sparke Helmore, Local Managing Partner, Melbourne office
general.description:
Sparke Helmore is a firm with more than 700 people working from eight offices across Australia, serving the needs to the insurance, government, financial services, technology, mining, construction and property services.

As a senior insurance partner and Managing Partner of the Melbourne office, I am responsible for our firm's excellence in client service delivery, and also for ensuring that we are nurturing a positive environment within the firm where our people and performance are world class.

jobs.description:
I am an experienced insurance lawyer, a partner at Sparke Helmore Lawyers, and the Managing Partner of the firm's Melbourne office.

My professional focus is advising insurers, brokers and intermediaries on professional indemnity, aviation and general liability classes.  My professional indemnity experience spans professionals in the health, allied health, insurance broking, construction and engineering sectors.  I regularly appear in the Victorian Civil & Administrative Appeals Tribunal, County and Supreme Courts of Victoria, and the District and Supreme Courts of NSW, including at an appellate level.

I am  honoured to have been recognised by my peers as a leading insurance lawyer in Victoria.  I believe that this is a reflection not only of the service I provide to my clients, but also my commitment to ensuring the highest ethical standards and proactive engagement of our legal teams and of our profession.
